title: Mums In Tech: How To Get Into Tech
description:
Interested in starting and building a career in tech?
Hana Abdi (Tech Lead) and Yasmin Benjamin (Cloud Engineer Manager) will share their journeys and share advice with you. How they got started, what the tech world is like for mothers and how you can start and build your career too!

Register for the event here: [https://www.mumsinctrl.com/events-1/mumsintech-how-to-get-into-tech-3](https://www.mumsinctrl.com/events-1/mumsintech-how-to-get-into-tech-3)

title: Mumpreneur Brunch Club
description:
Meet like-minded mothers for networking, mum-chat, good food, delicious tea and coffee, games, discussions and more.

Feel free to bring your babies, there is plenty of space and the venue is a relaxed environment.

Please **bring a £3** donation to put towards the food, drinks, venue and MIC staff.

title: How To Become a Published Author
description:
Got an idea for a book but not sure where to start?
Marlene Service has self-publish over 10 books while raising 3 children and she is here to share her journey while giving you practical steps that you can follow.

title: Mums In Tech: Virtual Mixer
description: Time for all the tech mums to get together again for more discussions and virtual networking.

title: Mums In Fashion: How To Build a Career In The Fashion Industry
description:
Are you a mum who wants to build a successful career in the fashion industry but don't know where to start?
Or maybe you're already in the fashion industry and you're wondering how you will be able to balance it all once you start a family...

This event is for you!

Come and hear from two successful fashion mums, Ashleigh Stunna (fashion stylist) and Lea-Asha Hibbert (fashion designer). They'll be sharing their journeys and experiences in the industry while giving you tips and advice on how you can do it too.

These mothers are making it happen and so can you!

title: How Become Financially Free, With The Right Mindset, In 2022
description:
The event is facilitated by Jay Hastings who I have worked with before, and shows how it takes a lot more than business strategy to make money - it's about your MINDSET and the way you think.

Join us for an absolute packed 90 minutes online meetup learning the exact type of mindset successful digital entrepreneurs and successful people have in order to capitalise no matter what the current global financial situation and make millions in the process.

Over the years we have trained thousands of people helping them understand how to create great success online as a small business owner or start up entrepreneur however unfortunately not everybody goes on to become successful.

Now why is this? is it because the training isn't very good? or is it because some of us want success although really do not quite understand what it takes to really produce results and change your life for the better. We have had people go on to generate 6 and even 7 figure businesses so its not the training its who we are that we need to take a closer look into

So, how do you create a mindset for business success? This FREE 'How To Program Your Mind For Success' meetup, delivered by one of the UK's leading digital marketers Jay Hastings. We will teach you how to adopt the right mindset from his experience living in a squat to now closing millions in sales and commission

We will be discussing the following topics:
- How successful entrepreneurs think
- How to ensure you are taking the right action to ensure results
- What does it really take to generate over £1 million in sales
- What should you focus on when getting started
- The mindset required to become fully financially free for years to come
- How to ensure you make much more money in 2022

Also included:
- What is the essential mindset required to generate your first £1 in business
- What it really takes to succeed
- Case studies students who have applied the mindset and have generated great results in the process

Who Is This Course For?

Anyone wanting to learn how to become financially successful
Anyone who has tried money making courses in the past but are still yet to generate results
Start-up entrepreneurs wanting to understand more about where to get started

Come along, learn the type of mindset successful entrepreneurs have, as well as learn how to get started on your road to financial freedom.

See you there

title: How Stress is Killing Your Immunity!
description:
I was just informed of this event which is facilitated by Tina Lawrence who is a qualified Nutritional Therapist.

In this FREE bite sized webinar we will look at the impact Stress has on your immune system.

- How Stress dampens your immune response
- How the Immune system works
- 7 things that disrupt your Immunity
- How Cortisol & Insulin activates a stress responses
- Tips to help reduce stress

We will also take a look at: What foods to eat and avoid, eating on a schedule with purpose for improved immunity

You will leave with a basic working knowledge of how the immune system works and how stress can impact your immunity. Together with practical hints and tips on ways to bolster your immunity moving forward.

Things to bring with you.
- Pen and paper to make notes
- Willingness to participate in group chat either on camera or in chat.

This is gonna be good !

title: Women's Health: Losing Hormonal Fat
description:
"If you don't have your heath what do you have?"

When practicing self-help it is also vital to start with your health, because without good health life can sometimes seem limiting. Being in the best health can help with so many other things.

This live event is facilitated by Tina Lawrence, a qualified nutritional therapist.

Ladies, If you are experiencing , weight gain, food cravings and low energy.

Its time to change the way you think about food, and weight loss, and switch your focus to balancing your hormones.

Hormones regulate the majority of the processes that happen in our bodies and can become out of balance for a number of reasons.

In this bite sized Webinar we will look at:
- Symptoms of Hormone Imbalance
- Lifestyle Hints and Tips to help balance your hormones
- Foods to Implement and Avoid

You will leave empowered and ready for your next steps moving towards a healthier and fitter you.

Things to bring with you:
- Willingness to engage with other women open and honestly either on camera or in the chat.
- Pen and paper to take notes.

title: Online Yoga Session For A Relaxed 2022
description:
My friend Helen is running a free online Yoga Session to release the stress from 2021 into a relaxed 2022

How does yoga help with stress?
Your mobile phone is ringing. Your boss wants to talk to you. And your partner wants to know what's for dinner. Stress and anxiety are everywhere. If they're getting the best of you, you might want to hit the mat and give yoga a try.

Yoga is a mind-body practice that combines physical poses, controlled breathing, and meditation or relaxation. Yoga may help reduce stress, lower blood pressure and lower your heart rate. And anyone can do it.

Yoga encourages mental and physical relaxation, which helps reduce stress and anxiety. The physical postures promote flexibility, relieve tension, and alleviate pain. Yoga poses may help you release physical blockages like muscle knots, helping release emotions and tension.

Join me for a relaxing FREE online class and experience for yourself the power of yoga. All you need is a space to move about in and something to stand on ( preferably a non-slip mat).
NOTES:
Don't have more than a couple of biscuits and a (non-alcoholic) drink for one hour before we start (otherwise you may feel sick when we start stretching and bending!)
Wear comfortable clothes.
Have a block, cushion or some books for support.
Have socks, jumpers and/or blankets for the relaxation (body temperature drops when you are lying still).

title: Improving Your Health And Nutrition For The New Year
description:
This webinar will be presented by my good friend Tina Lawrence

This FREE and easy to understand bite-sized webinar is designed to increase your understanding in the area of Food and Nutrition.

Giving you a basic understanding of all the food groups necessary to build healthy meal plans.

We will discuss nutrition basics, laying a foundation, before showing you how what we eat relates to how we feel.

You will leave empowered to make informed choices about your own health and well- being moving forward.

We will look at;
- Nutrition and what that really means
- Food group and nutrition basics
- The impact nutrition has on our daily performance
- Poor nutrition v optimal nutrition
- Five basic nutrition hacks to help optimize your health
- Recipe ideas to help create a healthy meals and more.

Things to bring with you.
- Pen and paper to make notes
- Willingness to participate in group chat either on camera or in chat.

title: All Women Can Do Anything
description:
This Webinar is for all mothers wanting to succeed in reaching their goals in life, but are not quite sure how or where to start.

This event is presented by my dear friend Sreina Ilyas

You will leave this event full of inspiration, with a go getting attitude, and realize that anything is possible.

All you will need to bring along with you to this webinar is yourself and a pen and paper, because i can assure you that you will definitely want to jot down as much info as you possibly can, from all the content that will be delivered to you on this day, as realization sets in on what we as mothers can truly achieve.

The world is our oyster ladies, so you really don't want to miss out on this jam packed event, that was specially designed just for us mothers.

title: MOTHERS - You Can Do Anything !
description:
This Webinar is presented by my dear friend Sreina Ilyas

This Webinar is for all mothers wanting to succeed in reaching their goals in life, but are not quite sure how or where to start.
You will leave this event full of inspiration, with a go getting attitude, and realize that anything is possible.
All you will need to bring along with you to this webinar is yourself and a pen and paper, because i can assure you that you will definitely want to jot down as much info as you possibly can, from all the content that will be delivered to you on this day, as realization sets in on what we as mothers can truly achieve.
The world is our oyster ladies, so you really don't want to miss out on this jam packed event, that was specially designed just for us mothers.

title: Better Nutrition, Better Health, Better Life
description:
The event will be presented by my dear friend Christina Lawrence who is a qualified Nutritional Therapist, specializing in family nutrition.

This FREE and easy to understand bite-sized webinar is designed to increase your understanding in the area of Food and Nutrition.
Giving you a basic understanding of all the food groups necessary to build healthy meal plans.
We will discuss nutrition basics, laying a foundation, before showing you how what we eat relates to how we feel.
You will leave empowered to make informed choices about your own health and well-being moving forward.
We will look at;

* Nutrition and what that really means
* Food group and nutrition basics
* The impact nutrition has on our daily performance
* Poor nutrition v optimal nutrition
* Five basic nutrition hacks to help optimize your health
* Recipe ideas to help create a healthy meals and more.

Things to bring with you.

* Pen and paper to make notes
* Willingness to participate in group chat either on camera or in chat.

title: Keeping Female Hormones In Balance
description:
Ladies, If you are experiencing , weight gain, food cravings and low energy.
Its time to change the way you think about food, and weight loss, and switch your focus to balancing your hormones.
Hormones regulate the majority of the processes that happen in our bodies and can become out of balance for a number of reasons.
In this bite sized Webinar we will look at:

* Symptoms of Hormone Imbalance
* Lifestyle Hints and Tips to help balance your hormones
* Foods to Implement and Avoid

You will leave empowered and ready for your next steps moving towards a healthier and fitter you.
Things to bring with you:

* Willingness to engage with other women open and honestly either on camera or in the chat.
* Pen and paper to take notes.

title: Mothers Have The Ability to Do Anything
description:
This is a event is for all mothers that don't feel they have the ability to do more, because they are putting there children first, but what if i told you that you can do whatever you want to do for yourself whatever it is you truly desire, with or without children?
WELL, YOU CAN!
And I'm living proof...
My upbringing wasn't good and my choice's in life weren't great either,,,,
I could go on and on but what's the point, just come to my webinars and see for yourself what you too can achieve for yourself.
Sreina Ilyas is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.
Topic: Mothers Can Do Anything
Time: Apr 16, 2022 03:00 PM UK London time

title: Teaching Your Children Financial Mastery
description:
Since the beginning of time, people have been asking "Does money grow on trees?" and most people think the answer is no. However we will reveal the secrets to you! Join me for this power-packed training as I show you how to nurture and grow you family's money tree & teach your children to do the same! If you tend to it, this financial tree will keep your family free of financial worry for years to come.

My name is Vanessa and I help people thrive. When you think of a personal trainer, this probably isn't what comes to mind: an entrepreneur who overcame her own financial challenges in order create something that helps other families as well! The goal of the training session is for parents like yourself, (natural entrepreneurs who want nothing more than to provide their children quality lives filled not only material goods but also emotional support), to grow up feeling confident about building passive income streams so they can afford college or saving up towards a home without worrying constantly whether there's enough money coming in.
This training will change your family life forever as you discover the power of financial freedom. You'll be able to give your children a head start on success and transform them into knowledgeable adults who are not only aware about money but financially savvy, business-minded and money confident, breaking the cycles of money worry and anxiety.
During this training you will:
💡Discover the 3 main challenges facing parents today
💡 Learn 3 effective and step-by-step, easy-to-implement solutions to strengthen your family's financial health
💡 Find out how to become a parent with multiple passive income streams
💡Find out how to become money confident and raise financially confident children at the same time
And much more!
Sign up now!

title: Ladies  - Start Your Own Online Business And Leave  The 9 To 5
description:
My friend Jay Hastings is back presenting another event

Join us for an absolute packed 90 minutes online meetup learning the exact type of mindset and skills required that successful digital entrepreneurs and business owners have in order to capitalize no matter what the current global financial situation and make millions in the process.
Over the years we have trained thousands of people helping them understand how to create great success as a small business owner or start up entrepreneur however unfortunately not everybody goes on to become successful.
Now why is this? is it because the training isn't very good? or is it because some of us want success although really do not quite understand what it takes to really produce results within your own business and change your life for the better. If you have had dreams of leaving the day job, starting a successful business then you really will need to hear what the foundations of success is all about
So, how do you really start getting to results you desire in business success? This FREE 'How Leave Your Day Job & Start A Successful Business In 2022' meetup, delivered by one of the UK's leading digital marketers Jay Hastings. We will teach you how to adopt the right mindset from his experience living in a squat to now closing millions in sales and commissions
We will be discussing the following topics:

* How successful entrepreneurs think
* How to ensure you are taking the right action to ensure results
* What does it really take to generate over £1 million in sales
* What should you focus on when getting started
* The mindset required to become fully financially free for years to come
* How to ensure you make much more money in 2022

Also included:

* What is the essential mindset required to generate your first £1 in business
* What it really takes to succeed
* Case studies students who have applied the mindset and have generated great results in the process

Who Is This Course For?
Anyone wanting to learn how to become financially successful
Anyone who has tried money making courses in the past but are still yet to generate results
Start-up entrepreneurs wanting to understand more about where to get started
Come along, learn the type of mindset successful entrepreneurs have, as well as learn how to get started on your road to financial freedom.
See you there
Jay Hastings

title: Ladies - Let's Use LinkedIn For Our Business
description:
My friend Paul Chuter, the Nomadic Entrepreneur is presenting

The Nomadic Entrepreneur Group support Meetup policies and principles. We are all about providing people with an opportunity to learn something new that may help you create a better lifestyle for yourself however attending our webinars does not mean that we guarantee success as we do not offer financial services or assurances.
I have been driving several hundred highly targeted visitors to high ticket coaching events each month and making four figure sums in the process. What is most impressive about this is everything you don’t have to do
I do this by using one of the most untapped traffic sources on the net… Linkedin.
Come and join me on my live workshop at 8pm on Monday 9th May where I will share…
🚀 How to do this fast and easy with no previous experience or understanding. You will be kicking yourself at how easy this is!
🚀 How to get tons of free traffic from Linkedin whilst everyone else is burning holes in their wallets with facebook ads.
🚀 How you don’t need a fancy website or landing page.
🚀Without having to work 4-8 hours per day to make it work
This session is perfect for you if…
🚀You don’t like selling but want to find a way to make weekly profits
🚀You don’t want to build a website, market and sell products
🚀You’re time poor and want to do something that does not require much time
🚀You’re not particularly tech savvy, and want a strategy that can easily be implemented
🚀You want to do all of this without it costing you any money at all on premium LinkedIn accounts or advertising spend.
Limited seating – so make sure you grab your seat now and show up 10 minutes early. I cannot promise replays to non attendees

title: Empowered Women For Success
description:
Hi there

This webinar is to empower women to be the best version of themselves. We only have one life to live and live it we must . There are no replays, no second chances, so why not live your life to it’s full potential.

Rhona Bicette is a Transformational Coach for women who will take you through personal development strategies to help you live your best life.

Do the any of the these apply to you:

* Are you afraid to take responsibility for your life
* Are you too comfortable and afraid of change
* You always procrastinate and never do what you say you want to do
* Do you fear of having control of your life and believe that life is just happening to you
* Feel you have limited choice in the way your life is going
* Are you stuck in a rut and living your life for everybody else
* Surrounded by negativity people who discourage your dreams

Time to change and start living the life you have always desired

If you answered yes to any of the points raised above then join me on this one hour webinar which will be held on zoom. It offers instant personal development steps you can use to change your life today!

So join me, Rhona at 7pm BST on Monday 30 May . Just RSVP and click on the link to join the meeting

See You There
Rhona

title: Social meet up Event
description: Feel free to join us on this lovely icebreaking friendly event where you get to meet new people and make real connections.

title: Social Event - Zoom
description:
Debate👩🏻‍🎓, Chat🙋🏼‍♂️, Make Friends 💁🏽‍♀️

Relax, ease back on your smartphone and let the club take you wherever it does.

Interact with real people, have real conversations, and make real connections.

Be curious, experiment, share ideas, and take the time to bring joy to someone’s day!

All are welcome 🌍🇺🇳

What happens in the event:

1) Introduction from the Host
2) You will be placed in 1-1 breakout room.

Breakout rooms are sessions that are split off from the main Zoom meeting. You will be given questions to help.

Breakout rooms allow you to completely be isolated in terms of audio and video from the main session.

3) Group returns to the main event for discussions

Participants can move around different rooms at any time.

Looking forward to seeing you all.

STEP 1: For an optimal experience, attending the event from your laptop or desktop computer is recommended. But if your phone is the only device you have access to, that’s totally fine.

STEP 2: Make sure you have access to Zoom. You can download the app on whichever device you are using (here’s the web link https://zoom.us/support/download or visit the app store). If you do not want to download Zoom, you can access the event straight from your browser.

STEP 3: Do a test run to make sure you’re set up correctly and that your camera, audio, and speakers work. https://zoom.us/test

General Rules:

This is an open-camera event.

We have a strict policy against poor etiquette of any kind. Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behavior will not be tolerated and will lead to immediate removal from the event and a lifetime ban from all future events.

Mute when not speaking. This stops background noise.

Do not send intrusive, pushy personal messages to club members.

In order to maintain our community, hosts reserve the right to remove any members.

Be curious, experiment, share ideas, and take the time to bring joy to someone’s day!

All are welcome 🌍🇺🇳

What happens in the event:

1) Introduction from the Host
2) You will be placed in a 1-1 / 4-4 breakout room.

Breakout rooms are sessions that are split off from the main Zoom meeting. You will be given questions to help.

Breakout rooms allow you to completely be isolated in terms of audio and video from the main session.

3) Group returns to the main event for discussions

Participants can move around different rooms at any time.

Looking forward to seeing you all.

STEP 1: For an optimal experience, attending the event from your laptop or desktop computer is recommended. But if your phone is the only device you have access to, that’s totally fine.

STEP 2: Make sure you have access to Zoom. You can download the app on whichever device you are using (here’s the web link https://zoom.us/support/download or visit the app store). If you do not want to download Zoom, you can access the event straight from your browser.

STEP 3: Do a test run to make sure you’re set up correctly and that your camera, audio, and speakers work. https://zoom.us/test

General Rules:

This is an open-camera event.

We have a strict policy against poor etiquette of any kind. Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behavior will not be tolerated and will lead to immediate removal from the event and a lifetime ban from all future events.

Mute when not speaking. This stops background noise.

Do not send intrusive, pushy personal messages to club members.

In order to maintain our community, hosts reserve the right to remove any members.

title: Speed Friending - Zoom Event
description:
Relax, ease back on your smartphone and let the event take you wherever it does.

Debate👩🏻‍🎓,Chat🙋🏼‍♂️, Make Friends 💁🏽‍♀️

All are welcome 🌍🇺🇳

It has been harder than usual to get out and meet people so we're stepping in with our virtual mixer. We'll match and group you and give you fun things to do so you can find new friends and folks to click with.It is traditional Speed-Friending in your home from your mobile, tablet or computer - anywhere you would like.

Just as with in-person events, you’ll have a host to assist you with anything or anyone, be able to privately chat with a new potential friendship connection every 7-8 minutes and select those whom you would be interested in connecting with. All in a safe environment .

Meet like-minded people for good conversations and new friendships.

Interact with real people, have real conversations, and make real connections.
Be curious, experiment, share ideas, and take the time to bring joy to someone’s day!

What is the event about?
an exact replica of traditional group meetings but instead they take place online using webcams.

How many people will I meet?
Each event will have around 15 -20. By keeping the numbers slightly lower than normal it means we can provide the best possible user experience and allocate more time to each date.

How long does each 1-1 conversations last?
Every 10 mins you will speak to someone new.

Will I meet people from outside London?
Group is aimed at London and the wider UK but all are welcome.

Do I need to download anything?
You will need to download the free video conferencing app Zoom through the app store

How much does it cost?
All events are free

Is it safe?

Absolutely - our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session.

.

title: Speed Friending - Zoom Event
description:
Debate👩🏻‍🎓, Chat🙋🏼‍♂️, Make Friends 💁🏽‍♀️. All are welcome 🌍🇺🇳

Relax, ease back on your smartphone and let the event take you wherever it does. Meet like-minded people for good conversations and new friendships.

How to participate
Download the Zoom app for free on a desktop or mobile device, they've made it super quick and easy. After you click attend, you’ll see the invitation link. Just a couple of clicks and you'll get straight into the event where your Host will be waiting to meet you.

What happens in the event:

1) Introduction from the Hosts. We will explain how the event works.

2) You will be placed in a 4-6 person breakout room.

3) You will be given questions/topics to help with discussions.

4) Participants can choose any Breakout rooms: You can select and enter rooms on your own once rooms are launched. This allows you to move around to different topics and conversations.

5) You can choose to have 1-1 conversations at any time by joining the friend zone breakout room.

Don't worry if you think you'll get stuck for something to say, Hosts will create breakout rooms with topics.

What is the event about?
A replica of traditional group meetings but instead they take place online using webcams.

How much does it cost?
All events are free

How many people will I meet?
Each event will have around 30-60 people.

Will I meet people from outside London?
Group is aimed at London and the wider UK but all are welcome.

Do I need to download anything?
You will need to download the free video conferencing app Zoom through the app store

Is it safe?
Absolutely - our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session.

⚠️Important Reminder ⚠️
Please ensure that when you register your attendance you attend the event. If you do decide not to attend please click not going.

General Rules:
We have a strict policy against poor etiquette of any kind. Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behaviour will not be tolerated and will lead to immediate removal from the event and a lifetime ban from all future events. Do not send intrusive, pushy personal messages to members. To maintain our community, hosts reserve the right to remove any members.

title: Speed Friending - Zoom Event
description:
Debate👩🏻‍🎓, Chat🙋🏼‍♂️, Make Friends 💁🏽‍♀️. All are welcome 🌍
Meet like-minded people for new friendships.

How to participate:

Download the Zoom app for free on a desktop or mobile device.
After you click attend (RSVP), you'll see the Zoom link to join the event.

What happens in the event:

1) Upon entering the event you will be in our virtual lobby where our event hosts will welcome you. We will explain how the event works.

2) Group Activity - Breakout rooms with different topics.

You will be placed in a 4-6 person breakout room with a topic.
Participants can self-select and join different breakout rooms that have topics the host has created.

3) You can choose to have 1-1 conversations at any time by joining the friend zone breakout rooms.

4) Once the event ends you can go to the attendance list and message your mutual matches.

Is it safe?

Absolutely - our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session.

Help during the event.

You can reach your event hosts at any time during the event.
If you click Ask for Help in Zoom, it will notify the meeting host that you need assistance.

READ - Important Rules

1) Late arrivals will not be admitted.

title: Speed Friending - Zoom Event

1) Introduction from the Hosts. We will explain how the event works.

2) You will be placed in a 4-6 person breakout room with a topic.

3 Participants can choose any Breakout rooms: You can select and enter rooms on your own once rooms are launched. This allows you to move around to different topics and conversations.

4) You can choose to have 1-1 conversations at any time by joining the friend zone breakout room.

How many people will I meet?
Each event will have around 30-60 people.

Is it safe?
Absolutely - our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session.

Please ensure that when you register your attendance you attend the event. If you do decide not to attend please click not going.

General Rules:
We have a strict policy against poor etiquette of any kind. Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behaviour will not be tolerated and will lead to immediate removal from the event and a lifetime ban from all future events. Do not send intrusive, pushy personal messages to members.

Download the Zoom app for free on a desktop or mobile device.
After you click attend, you'll see the Zoom link to join the event.

What happens in the event:

1️⃣ Upon entering the event you will be in our virtual lobby where our event hosts will welcome you. We will explain how the event works.

2️⃣Group Activity - Breakout rooms with different topics. You will be placed in a 4-6 person breakout room with a topic. Participants can self-select and join different breakout rooms that have topics the host has created.

3️⃣ You can choose to have 1-1 conversations at any time by joining the friend zone breakout rooms.

4️⃣ Once the event ends you can go to the attendance list and message your mutual matches.

Is it safe?

Absolutely - our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session.

🤔 Help during the event.

You can reach your event hosts at any time during the event.
If you click Ask for Help in Zoom, it will notify the meeting host that you need assistance.

Is it safe?
Absolutely - All our events are hosted will be monitored throughout the session. if you have any issues, report them to the hosts.

❤️Feel free to support the group.
https://www.buymeacoffee.com/MeetUp

Important Rules
We have a strict policy against poor etiquette of any kind. Bad manners, rude comments, and/or inappropriate and disruptive behavior will lead to immediate removal from the event.

title: New Years Eve - Group Friending - Zoom Party
description:
A virtual party is exactly what it sounds like — a celebration online.

it's finally here! 2022 is here! Let's join together to celebrate New Year's Eve.

The recent news confirms that it is once again time for us to show up responsibly, with care & compassion to protect our community at times of uncertainty.

We are a commUNITY! 💞

💙 💛 🤎 🧡 🤍 ❤️ 🖤 💚 💜

Debate👩🏻‍🎓, Chat🙋🏼‍♂️, Make Friends 💁🏽‍♀️. All are welcome 🌍

SOMETHING FOR SINGLES:
If you haven’t found your soulmate in 2020, tonight may be your opportunity. We will host several breakout rooms for optional Single mixers. Each room will represent different topics.

GENERAL MIXER
Whether or not you are not single, if you are in the mood to just meet new friends and chat, break-out rooms will be available all night to hang with new friends and welcome in 2022.

Meet like-minded people for new friendships.

title: THAMES RIVER CRUISE WESTMINSTER TO GREENWICH
description:
NEW DATE FINALLY SET FOR THIS COMING SATURDAY 29th AUGUST

Cruise with us along the Thames from Westminster to Greenwich, taking in the view of London from the Thames with interesting and enlightening commentary. In Greenwich, wander through the park to the Cutty Sark then on for lunch at the famous Goddards Pie & Mash Shop and a cup of tea or a beer before cruising back to Westminster.

Buy your ticket at the city cruises kiosk on Westminster Pier on the day. Show your Oyster card or freedom pass to get a discount 😊

title: THAMES RIVER CRUISE WESTMINSTER TO GREENWICH
description:
Cruise with us along the Thames from Westminster to Greenwich, taking in the view of London from the Thames with interesting and enlightening commentary. In Greenwich, wander through the park to the Cutty Sark then on for lunch at the famous Goddards Pie & Mash Shop and a cup of tea or a beer for a fiver before cruising back to Westminster.

We will be going with Thames River Sightseeing (TRS). We will meet up at the spot shown on the photo (in front of their ticket booth), before buying our tickets at their kiosk on Westminster Pier on the day and taking the 11.30 sailing.
Bring your Oyster card or freedom pass to get a discount 😊

title: PROUD CABARET WITH BILL BAILEY
description:
Really excited to have been offered tickets for this cabaret show at £6.50 each. You need to be quick!

Event Description:

With alumni from the legendary Cirque du Soleil, we have the crème de la crème of international talent all on one stage.

Cabaret All Stars featuring Bill Bailey

Bill Bailey joins the biggest show in London’s West End headlining an International cast of award-winning acts. This must be seen to be believed!

With performances embodying the spirit of the swinging sixties & sexy seventies, we give you an experience of a lifetime. Enjoy world-class jazz musicians and on-stage bands, award-winning acrobats, fire breathers and burlesque beauties. Be prepared to be amazed. This is an unforgettable night out.

Please note: Dress Code is glam, strictly no jeans or trainers.

title: MY FAIR LADY £35
description:
The Lincoln Center Theater’s critically acclaimed, multi-award-winning production of My Fair Lady comes to London in Summer 2022, the first major West End revival of Lerner & Loewe’s much-loved musical for 21 years.

This 16-week engagement at the London Coliseum is a truly loverly way to celebrate London’s theatre scene back in bloom!

My Fair Lady tells the story of Eliza Doolittle, a young Cockney flower seller, and Henry Higgins, a linguistics professor who is determined to transform her into his idea of a “proper lady”. But who is really being transformed?

Directed by Bartlett Sher, this sublime production will feature the English National Opera orchestra playing Frederick Loewe’s ravishing score and a book and lyrics by Alan Jay Lerner. My Fair Lady boasts a score including the classic songs I Could Have Danced All Night, Get Me to the Church on Time, Wouldn’t It Be Loverly, On the Street Where You Live, The Rain in Spain, and I’ve Grown Accustomed to Her Face.

“Lerner and Loewe’s My Fair Lady has returned to Broadway in a smashing new production from Bartlett Sher (The Sound of Music, The King and I).”

The Guardian

“Lavish revival of Lerner and Loewe’s 1956 masterwork…”

The Washington Post

“Thrilling! Glorious and better than it ever was! A marvellous and transformative revival.”

New York Times

Important COVID-19 information

Mask

You are required to wear a mask while inside this venue.

title:
MULAN ROUGE CABARET 
INCLUDING 4 COURSE MEAL £25
description:
‼️WE NEED TO BOOK FAST‼️ £25 ticket includes four courses - strictly limited availability. Dinner will be a gluttonous feast fit for the green fairy. Service is towards the end the performance (approx 1 hour after your start time). All dietary requirements will be catered for if notified 24 hrs in advance.

Bohemians, you have been invited to the spectacular of the century, the Mulan Rouge! It's time to leave your gender at the door, adorn your finest armour and pack your glitter purse - or risk bringing dishonour to us all.
This year, the heart of The Vaults has been transformed into the infamous Mulan Rouge, a scandalous haven of dancing and naughty delights.
The Vaults, with ShayShay, have taken the wonderful worlds of Disney’s Mulan and Baz Luhrmann’s Moulin Rouge and crashed together a drag-tastic parody - fusing comedy, burlesque and a feast to boot. This is a cabaret of fabulous kings and queens, set to take you on Mulan’s journey of self discovery; and where better to make that discovery than the Mulan Rouge!
Across the lands, a terrifying whisper is taking hold: The Huns are preparing to attack! Mulan disguises themself as a man to join the war effort, but when their regiment commandeers the glittering Mulan Rouge, they find themself surrounded by glitz, glamour and go-go girls. Come what may, Mulan’s identity must be kept secret to defeat The Huns and defend the honour of the Mulan Rouge. Though when they meet a girl worth fighting for, will the whole plan go up in smoke?
So grab all your soul sistas (lemme hear y’all flow sistas) and descend below the flames of Paris for a burning hot, drag-tastic soiree. Down here, diamonds really are a queen’s best friend.
With a feast and cocktails fit for the green fairy, we can promise you a night of spectacular as mysterious as the dark side of the moon. So let's get down to busy-ness!
Doors 6:30pm Venue recommend arriving at 7:00pm Show starts promptly at 7:15pm
Suitable for Ages 18+. Sexually explicit and strong language. Late comers shall not be admitted. Entrance is via our Leake Street entrance.
Dress Code: A hot Paris night in the Mulan Rouge. Adorn yourself in your finest glam and armour, dress to impress and join the dazzling girls of the Mulan Rouge. Please remember, cultural garments are NOT costumes.

“The room was electrified with a celebration of identity” LONDON THEATRE REVIEW

“A stroke of genius" THE REVIEWS HUB

“A true must-see” THEATRE AND OTHER THINGS

“A joyful riot" LONDON THEATRE1.

“Colourful, filthy and funny. Ribald, big-hearted and well-performed." THE STAGE

“Pure, queer joy from start to finish." QUEER CULTURE CLUB
“Epic musical numbers, beautiful costumes and sharp writing." NEVER FEAR NEW
“Simply fabulous darling, the best yet." LOVE POP UPS LONDON
Mulan Rouge

title:
Worlds biggest magic illusion show 
Ehrlich Brothers at OVO WEMBLEY
description:
‼️BOOK FAST TO GET REDUCED TICKETS £15‼️

With their fresh and unexpected shows the Ehrlich Brothers celebrate massive success like never seen before with any illusion show. The two brothers drew more than two million people of all ages across the biggest arenas in Germany. They are the only magicians worldwide who sold out a football stadium with 40,000 people, gaining them two world records. The Ehrlich Brothers’ show features mind-blowing spectacular illusions, close-up magic right in the middle of the audience, enchanting and surprising for the whole family. Now they set out for their first UK dates with their brand-new show DREAM & FLY. An irresistible breathtaking experience taking magic to new dimensions.  What was formerly a rabbit jumping out of a hat, today, is a heavy-weighted Harley blasting out of an oversized iPad. With their sensational shows Andreas and Chris Ehrlich, are taking magic into a new era and creating a fervor across the generations. Their overwhelming success story in Germany is rapidly spreading to many foreign countries. For their accomplishments in the art of magic, Andreas und Chris Ehrlich were appointed members of honor in the “Magic Circle“ of Great Britain– a recognition shared with distinguished magicians like David Copperfield and Siegfried and Roy.  From appearing in a helicopter ﬂying in mid-air, sculpting a golden Lamborghini from ﬂames to producing the world‘s largest candy jar, bulging with thousands of sweets – this show is something that has to be seen to be believed.  DREAM & FLY is being performed at the OVO Arena Wembley for the ﬁrst time ever in English. It is perfect for the entire family and will enchant imaginations bringing to life the kid inside every one of us.  With the Ehrlich Brothers, illusions become reality. Using a perfect mixture of elaborate illusions, sleight of hand, energy and charm, the Brothers’ performances dissolve easily onto an audience of 6 to 99.
Doors open at 6.30pm & Event starts at 7.30pm

venue.address: Arena Square, Engineers Way, Wembley Park, Wembley, HA9 0AA

title: VIENNA CHRISTMAS MARKETS & ANDRE RIEU CONCERT
description:
We did this trip in November and were truly amazed at the Christmas markets and friendly atmosphere.

The Andre Rieu concert was postponed and has been rescheduled for 17th November.
We will fly out on 16th and return on 20th. Stay in a hotel near the city, see the concert, cruise the Danube, sightseeing and enjoy!

Rough estimate of costs:
Return flights are currently £78.
Hotel is £75 per night single occupancy (less if you are happy to share).
Concert tickets are €89.
Food and drinks are very reasonable.
Allow £20 for taxis to and from airport.

I will open a WhatsApp group chat to discuss details further so let me know your phone number.

PLEASE ONLY RSVP IF YOU ARE A PAID UP MEMBER AND ARE GENUINELY INTERESTED TO AVOID TIME WASTING AS THIS NEEDS TO BE BOOKED VERY SOON.

‼️IMPORTANT ‼️ PLEASE READ CAREFULLY OUR TERMS AND CONDITIONS SET OUT UNDER THE ‘ABOUT US’ SECTION.

title: SQUAD Coached Advanced Volleyball - Open Session
description:
Welcome to SQUAD Advanced Coached Volleyball sessions.

We meet on Monday evenings 8-10pm at Bacon's College in Canada Water for fun but competitive volleyball!

Level: Advanced/Upper Intermediate only. (Players need to have strong all-round skills and know the 5-1 rotation system and positions)

Session Structure: 1 hour coached drills & 1 hour playing time

Cost: £ 10 per session

Maximum Capacity: 14 players.

Attitude: Positive and friendly atmosphere

Book your place ASAP and any question please contact us here or via our Facebook page.

title: Coached Service Skills Session
description:
Our coach Priscilla is running another volleyball skills session for both our SQUAD and Non-SQUAD players!

On the 5th April, we will be focusing on serving skills. The session will cover technique for different types of services such as float serve, jump float and jump serve. It will also involve some time on strengthening the muscles used.

To allow our coach to work on each individual’s need and technique, there are only 12 spaces available.

*Cost*
£12 non-SQUAD members
£10.5 SQUAD member

*Day and Time*
Friday 5th April 18:00 - 20:00

Please let us know if you are in for a rewarding and fun two hours of quality volleyball skill session

title: Meet in a pub
description: Come and have a drink with some friendly folks. Have a moan, ask each other some questions, share the fun bits if there are any!!

title: Meet in a pub and chat about divorce (and other stuff)
description: Welcome to all you new members - great to see you! Our last meet up was a very relaxed affair with some lovely people. So do join us for our next night in the pub. Previous Divorce Clubbers please note that the venue is different this week, although we may go back to the Perseverance in future if I can secure the private bar upstairs. Please RSVP via meetup if you are coming as if there are lots of you I will have to book more table space. Really looking forward to seeing some new faces and welcoming back the people we've already met. See you soon!

title: Meet in a Pub and Talk About Divorce and Other Stuff
description:
From the last meet-up.

"Your ex out-mentalises mine. Wow."

"I used to think that no matter how hard you worked, you could be successful in anything. Now I know that's not true".

"You guys need a sign. You look too normal!!"

VENUE TBC come and meet some nice normal people who have all done or are doing the not-so-nice divorce thing.

title: Let's Meetup Again and Talk About Divorce, The Universe and Everything
description:
Hey everyone, sorry I wasn't there at the last meetup. I am feeling fully restored and really excited about the next meetup - Jane, Isabelle and I will all be there to welcome you all to an evening of drinks and chat amongst folks who know what it's like to go through the hideousness of divorce and the wry humour and exciting possibilities that the future holds...

Please can you RSVP if poss, as we are getting quite big now. If we have more than about 20 turning up, I'll have to turn up early to baggsy more space - a nice problem to have!

See you all soon,

Lucy

title: Let's Meet Up and Moan, Laugh and Have a Beer with Divorcees
description:
Hello, time for another night of divorce revelry. A time to have a moan, a laugh and wonder at the craziness of our new post separation lives. We'll be in the upstairs room at the Perseverance. See you there!
Lucy

title: Picnic and Drinks And A Backup Plan
description: Lovely divorce clubbers. Please join us for this lovely evening opportunity to get out, off load the anxiety to an understanding divorce peer while celebrating summer with a delicious drink and something yummy to eat. Oh... and we have the perseverance booked in case it rains. Although we will provide some drink and nibbles, we would appreciate it if you brought something to drink. Look forward to seeing you all soon!

title: Strawberries and Fizz
description: Following the success of last meetup, we shall have another picnic to meet other d.c. members to share experiences while looking to the future. We are a very eclectic bunch so come along!

title: Last Of The Summer
description: Our picnics have gone down well and so far the weather has been kind. So we will attempt one last picnic. People have tended to bring something to drink and nibble on but most importantly just bring yourselves. This is a welcoming group and people have actually found themselves having fun so please come along x

venue.address: 39 Woburn Pl London WC1H 0JR United Kingdom

title: Dancing!
description: I have 2 spare tickets to see 2manyDJs at the Camden Roundhouse tonight. Dan and I are going - if any of you fancy coming let me know! Lucy x

title: DC walk Ben Nevis
description:
UPDATE 26/08/2015

Hi team - I have just booked the flights for Ben Nevis for Lucy, Isabelle and myself - anyone keen to come...please let us know and please do book your flights. We are intending to drive from and back to Glasgow - Ben Nevis - so would be great if we could take the same/similar flights.

Everyone welcome! (Skyscanner was useful)

http://photos1.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/8/6/1/3/600_441334323.jpeg

UPDATE -

Team Ben Nevis. Details below.....

To reassure - we will take the easy route up.....so it will be like a walk rather than a climb.

Dates - Friday 18th - Sunday 20th September

Total cost - c£180 including flights and accommodation

Costs: Accommodation (Glen Nevis Youth Hostel) £40 pp for 2 nights - I have booked this already

Flight - Book your own return on Skyscanner to Glasgow - suggestion £93 return attached

http://photos3.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/a/9/d/9/600_441103481.jpeg

Meal - Ben Nevis pub recommended -

Transport from airport - I will bookCar Hire - likely £30 pp max

Let me know any more qus and let me know who is in....(limited availability due to accommodation booking)

Best wishes,
Jane, Isabelle and Lucy

1st details on this

Hi!

This is Jane - one of the founders - writing on all our behalf.

Isabelle and I started to spend more time together in 2014, discussing divorce among other things....(before we had the great good fortune to meet Lucy).

One of the first things we did was to climb Mount Snowdon (here we are, at the top, in September 2014). We went there just the two of us and ended up climbing the mountain with a man called Ed who had brought along his daughter and her new boyfriend. It was brilliant - and pretty stress-relieving...not least because it is so beautiful there.

We loved it so much that we are planning to walk Ben Nevis in September and would love it if anyone who is keen would be up for joining us. The info is below - and just shout if you have any questions. We can give more info on Thursday at the Meet-up - and on Friday we will ensure it is posted here for those who can't make it on Thursday.

http://photos4.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/f/9/e/600_440463998.jpeg

Weekend of 18th-20th September 2015

(no of nights away likely 1 - Saturday 19th September - we will likely organise transport and accommodation - will keep you posted on costs)

More information about Ben Nevis can be found here:

http://bit.ly/1eksyPB

Details TBC - do let us know if you'd be interested in joining us.

Best wishes,

Lucy, Isabelle and Jane

title: Autumn Meetup
description: As the weather changes find some warmth in the cozy pub and from our lovely members. We will be upstairs. Can't wait to meet the new members and catch up with the rest of you xxx

title: Walk on Hampstead Heath (followed by lunch)
description: Plan to meet at 11am - have an amazing walk and then eat!

venue.address: Hampstead Heath Railway Station, South End Road

title: Remember Remember the 5th of November (in the pub)
description:
Hello everyone!

How did it get to November already?

So for those of you with more than enough explosions in your life to want to brave a midweek firework display, we're going to create a bit of sparkle and fizz of our own by meeting up for chats, drinks and nibbles in our old favourite haunt, The Perseverance.

Come and meet other likeminded people for a warm and friendly welcome where you can let off steam about life, the universe and everything (and divorce), knowing that we all know where you're coming from.

The upstairs room is booked from 7.30pm but it'll be available earlier for anyone that just wants a quiet moment straight after work.

(New members: please note we are a social group and not a dating group. There are plenty of dating clubs out there for those of you that are ready - and good luck!)

See you all soon!

Lucy, Isabelle and Jane

title: Relaxing Xmas Drink
description: By popular demand, a quiet drink has been requested in la Gourmandina. It is a lovely bar and will be a nice opportunity to relax pre-xmas madness.

title: Meet for a New Year Hello
description: Happy New Year everyone! for everyone who wants to meet up for a NY hello, we are going for drinks at one of our regular venues - either The Perseverance or the Coach and Horses in Soho. I am just waiting for confirmation of which one and will post asap. We hope you've all had a good Christmas and look forward to seeing a few of you really soon. L, J & I

title: Share Your Story
description: We have been going for a year and have had a really great feedback about how valuable and reassuring it has been to hear from others how they have coped. We would love people to share their wisdom, thoughts or advice on camera as we will be filming. The day is about sharing your coping strategies rather than the details of your personal life. We want as many people as possible to feel support, so please let us know if you would like to come along and use your experience to help others. For those who are in too fragile a place to share thoughts or advice for others, please come along to our social meetup on Tuesday 12th, where you will find friendly faces and supportive listeners.

title: Feb Fun After Jan Blues
description: Our lovely and friendly meet up will be having drinks once again to warm each others hearts with humour and kindness in this cold month. Hope to see you

title: Marking The Start Of Spring
description: Drinks in the perseverence to discuss our plans and projects for the spring and summer. Out with the old and in with the new! Always lovely to meet new people and to see regulars and how far they have come post divorce!

title: April - So much more than the month of showers
description: April Fool's Day, Showers....let's make April the best month of 2016 so far. How better to mark it than an amazing meet up? Come, chat and meet new people in the mighty Perseverance!

title: 11am Walk Regents Park - 1.30pm Lunch at Lansdowne, Gloucester Avenue
description:
Last night we discussed walking and eating - a la what we've done before on a Sunday on Hampstead Heath.

I thought I would get the party started by suggesting this. Some details may change but in principle I am already excited!

I was thinking of 1.30pm for lunch - is that too late?

title: Bbq And Videos.
description: Bbq summer is on it's way! Summer is also a great time to meet people. So let's combine these for a great opportunity to meet others in a relaxed environment. For those who made a video a while back, we would also like to show it to you. (They look brill). So come along. I will provide food and drink but if you would like to contribute with food, money (£4), or something to drink would be appreciated.

title: Picnic In The Park - Now In Pub
description: A relaxing, post work picnic where you can meet other people or see familiar faces. Ask any question about marriage or divorce here or just meet a really great bunch of people who I have enjoyed every time

venue.address: 39 Woburn Pl London WC1H 0JR United Kingdom

title: Picnic in Green Park
description:
Hello everyone, we are determined to have an outdoor event at least once this summer!
Apologies for park confusion. Due to members worries about finding each other we moved it to green park. We will meet near the Canada memorial.

The back up plan if it's raining is Ye Grapes at 16 Shepherds Market.

Hope to see you all soon, Lucy x

title: Picnic In The Square
description:
Buoyed up by the good weather on the last picnic, let's try our luck and go for another outdoor meet. New members feel free to message me and I'll send you my number so you can find us. I will also have a stripy pillowcase flag on display to identify us (!)
I will bring fizz, cheese and bread, any other contributions are welcome but equally feel free to come without.
In case of inclement weather we'll go to the Marquis Cornwallis which is round the corner in Bloomsbury:

31 Marchmont Street, London, Greater London, WC1N 1AP

http://www.themarquiscornwalliswc1.co.uk/

There have been a few newly divorcing folks join our club recently, please come and join us. You'll have a sympathetic ear, and be amongst friends who know what it's like. It really helps!

title: let's have a picnic on Primrose Hill and admire London!
description: We are just down from the top of primrose hill with a bright green picnic blanket!!!

title: Divorce club drinks - stories, support and news
description:
Hello! Sorry we're a bit later this month - we're meeting up on 18th October.

I know some of you have had busy divorce months, so do come along for a drink, some snacks and we can swop notes/ advice. Hope you are all well and really looking forward to seeing you all.

To new members: we are a group that meet informally for drinks and chat. It's really helpful when you're going through a divorce to talk to others in the same boat. We're not a therapy group, just a bunch of people who know what it's like - although some people find our meets very therapeutic! But contrary to expectations, we usually have a laugh and a joke. Please come along and feel free to message me here or at lucy@divorceclub.com if you want to talk to me before coming along.

Cheers, Lucy

title: Relaxing, drinking and nattering about the past and future!
description: As the nights get longer, don't stay cooped up! Come to our friendly meetup where you can talk about divorce, children, new relationships or anything you like with some lovely people. There is also a lot of laughter to cheer you up!

title: Workshop with Rachel New
description:
Wondering how to put yourself out there post divorce? Rachel New has the answers...

Pay £4 in advance by PayPal or £5 on the night. Time: 7pm for 7.30pm start.

***IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO COME SEND ME AN EMAIL lucy@divorceclub.com AND YOU GET ALL OUR NOTIFICATIONS IN ADVANCE OF THE EVENT***

title: Christmas Shindig - Bowling
description:
No one can go bowling and not laugh! and we all need a bit of a laugh around Christmas.

We have been through some ups and downs and deserve to celebrate.

So pizza and drink at 7pm and then we have lanes hired from 9pm at Bloomsbury Bowls

A couple of things, I am going to have to pay out of my own pocket. So if possible, could confirm and pay me (£12) then that would be great. I will not be making any money out of you.

See http://www.divorceclub.com

And if you don't want to bowl or eat, you can still just come along

Look forward to seeing/meeting you all

Isabelle & Lucy

http://www.divorceclub.com

title: share your story
description:
One of the things that we have all found really helpful in moving through a divorce is sharing our stories with others. Realising divorce is something a lot of people experience and that there is light at the end of the tunnel is enormously helpful.

If you have watched or read other people’s stories, learned from others’ advice, taken heart from others’ support, would you consider doing the same and talking to us about your story?

We are filming on 14th and 15th January 2017 and would love to hear from anyone who would like to get involved. There will be drinks and nibbles and other people to chat to. You can meet Danny, the nicest cameraman in the world and sit in on Isabelle and I as we film our bits and bobs too. Or maybe you just fancy popping along to say hello.

If you are interested or would like to find out more, please email me: lucy@divorceclub.com and I can tell you all about it.

title: January New Beginnings
description:
January is a time for new starts. What is more positive than meeting new people?! We are a positive and welcoming bunch and our members vary from those who are fresh at the coal face, and those who have been through the worst but just like dropping in on some old friends.

Whether you want to share your story or move on and forget the past, everyone here will be able to appreciate you.

So come and join us soon!

title: Celebrate Anti-Valentine's Day
description:
https://a248.e.akamai.net/secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/9/f/3/a/600_458020762.jpeg

Are you separated/ divorcing/ alone on Valentine's day?

Don't get the blues - come and join us in an evening of celebrating life, friendship, London, and all the good things 14th February.

There will be games for those that want them and a chance to meet nice people who have all rejected the option of paying 3 times the normal price for dinner with someone who annoys them!

Come and join us in our alternative Valentine's night out!

Lucy and Isabelle

title: Talk and/or play games
description:
Roll the dice and come to this evening. Meet others looking to make friends and start again.

We hope this evening will be a mixture of your adult and child side as you choose either to play some games (Cluedo, connect 4, cards....and many more) and talk about past marriage(s) (ergh!) and future plans.

We aim to be in the Perseverance pub but there is a possibility that it will change and so watch this space.

title: Divorce Club Easter Hunt
description:
Why should only children get to do Easter Hunts?

This will be an Easter Hunt for adults. We will put some quizzes and clues to try and find the hidden chocolate and prizes.

So you get to meet new people, have a nice walk, engage you mind and eat chocolate! What could be better on a Sunday. Meet at the Jubilee Gate, regents park.

Come and join us! - Children welcome too

venue.address: Jubilee Gate, Inner Circle, York Bridge

title: May Day! May Day! Canal stroll.
description:
Discover a new part of London and help kick off National Walking Month! We will be starting at Broadway Market, grabbing a coffee, and then starting off on our journey to discover this feat of engineering while meeting some new people.

If you want to join us on the journey, I will put details up of our stops shortly - watch this space!

Making friends, exercising, learning and imbibing - Is there a better way to spend a bank holiday?

title: Filming day
description:
Our website (www.divorceclub.com) relies on our brilliant members sharing their experiences of divorce and how they got through it.

The filming takes just 20 minutes and is usually a Q & A asking you about what you felt and learned and (hopefully) how much better it is now. Most people stay longer and chat to the other divorcees taking part. There is tea, coffee, nibbles and beer later in the day. It's a very sociable, lighthearted affair but very helpful for other people.

If you are interested in contributing then please get in touch by contacting us through meetup or lucy@divorceclub.com

We want people to be happy with the outcome so you will have control at every stage. If you decide that you do not like your video, you can take it down any time.

Thanks for helping us make divorce feel more normal and for helping others to feel better.

title: Summer picnics start here!
description:
Summer is here!! Is there a better way to spend an evening other than pleasant conversation and a tipple in a nice garden?

We have had a great turn out with this event and always lots of old and new people looking to connect.

We will have outdoor Jenga and some bowls for those with a competitive spirit.

Although we do provide some food and drink, we do ask people to contribute if they have the time.

We look forward to seeing you all!

title: BBQ Time!
description:
One of the best things about summer is socialising and BBQs. So do both in this lovely evening in one of the nicest squares in London (which actually allow BBQs)

We are going to combine the two so bring a small contribution if you can (but don't worry if you can't). And also don't worry about what to eat. We have done so many of these and there has never been a shortage of food or drink. It somehow seems to work out thanks to the natural generosity of everyone. Don't bring meat because we will just have too much.

Check us out on www.divorceclub.com

We had such a nice evening last time with new and old members. Can't wait!

Here is the blanket to look for.

https://secure.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/5/f/4/6/600_453864390.jpeg

title: Flight Club - A darts bar with a twist (it is fun)
description:
This flight club is nothing like Fight Club. It is a dart bar that have slightly different games to make it more fun. Also, you don't have to drink beer as there are plenty of other options.
What is nice about this bar is that if you don't like darts, you get your own area so it is easy to talk.
If you are no good at darts, I promise you will be better than me so don't worry about that either!

title: Social meetup and welcome to divorce author, Wendi Schuller!
description:
Has anyone else been walloped by the change of seasons? Wet and cold - bah! And for those contending with a divorce or relationship issues, the grim weather doesn't help our moods. So if anyone fancies a warming drink come and meet up on Tuesday next week. We are also delighted to welcome Wendy Schuller, author of The Global Guide to Divorce. Wendy will be here to be sociable but I'm sure if you have any questions for her she'd be delighted to answer. I met Wendy a few months ago and she is a lovely, approachable woman who has worked tirelessly to help people as they go through this rubbish time. So come along and join me and Wendy for an autumnal, warming drink and some companionship. Lucy x
p.s. please RSVP for numbers as I will book an area. Truckles is a new venue for us so if you've been let me know feedback!

title: Divorce Club Party - Speed Hating
description:
We want to celebrate our 3rd Birthday!

There will be a range of activities to meet new people, relax, let go of remaining anger and most of all HAVE FUN.

There will also be drinks and nibbles.

For those that need a bit more TLC, there are the gentler options of Thai Chi, mindfulness meditation and a massage. A bit of dancing will get rid of any lingering anger...

Our party will take place on Saturday 21st October, 7-11 pm.

See www.divorceclub.com (http://www.divorceclub.com/)

title: Mulled Wine & Bowling - Xmas meet
description:
Bowling and mulled wine - Not your normal way to be festive but both are fun and bring laughter, and are MUCH better than doing nothing on a Sunday.

Why not see off the year with our lovely meetup and look ahead to how the next year will be better.

For those who do not like mulled wine or bowling, you don't have to bowl, you can join anyway and sit by the lane and have a bite before/after.

For those who don't like mulled wine, there are also soft drinks and alcoholic drinks.

For those who have always wished to hve mulled wine while bowling..... your luck is finally in!

One more thing, I have currently paid for this bowling out of my own pocket.

It will cost £10.

Please message me on meetup for my bank details if you wish to come.

title: Pot luck Christmas!!
description:
• What we'll do
This is a potluck or “bring-a-dish” lunch event. Any questions feel free to ask me! :) I will send out an email closer to the date with the full address. Oval station and Vauxhall station are about 5 minutes walk from my place.

• What to bring
Food to share

• Important to know

title: New Year, New Start
description:
January is the most popular time of year for people to decide to separate or divorce. As if the month could get any bleaker!

But don't despair. Divorce Club have lined up an event to help you blow out those cobwebs and start the year as you mean to go on - positive, full of great goals for the New Year, ready to meet new friends and form new relationships, start new (or previously loved but long untended) hobbies and have a fun night out.

The evening is upstairs at the Rugby Tavern and there will be plenty of opportunities to meet people and have a chat in an informal way, but also if you are a bit shy, there are also plenty of things to do that will help break the ice.

Would you like this new Year to be a squillion times better than this one? Do you want to set new goals or try something new? Would you like to try a new hobby or find a rewarding way to use your time?

Take the chance to set goals for the new year. Not just punitive NY resolutions but goals that you actually look forward to acting on! You can also join the hobby/ volunteering challenge. Anyone who commits to trying out a new hobby can be part of our special group set up on the night to gee each other up for moral support. Get pointers on where to start. Get a deadline to help with motivation! Don’t even know what to try? Take a chance on our Try Something New tombola!

Are you ready to meet new people or start a relationship but confused by the new online websites and apps?

Relationship Coach Rachel New will have advice and individual help for people who need help with profiles, pics, messaging and etiquette. Rachel has run several fantastic workshops which are jam packed with advice and useful tips to help navigate what can be an enormously fun way to spend your time.

Could you do with looking after yourself a bit more? Finding a more sustainable way of living/ managing stress?

Clinical Psychologist, Isabelle Hung, will help you feel just a little bit more fantastic than you did when you walked in… She will help you think about your well being issues whether they be work/life balance, stress management, or simply looking after yourself. Come to our well being corner and feel a bit more human as a result. We’ve got your back…

Come and get some advice, support and exercises to help you in the darker moments. And remember, just the act of getting out and meeting people can be the best tonic you can have. Don't worry if you don't know anyone - just email admin@divorceclub.com in advance and we will know to look out for you, or tell us you need some help with introductions when you arrive. We work hard to make sure everyone is put at their ease.

The nights are long and black, but we don't have to be - come and enjoy an event to put a New Year spring in your step!

There will be prizes, ice breakers, and no-one leaves empty handed. Hope to see you all there.

Lucy, Isabelle and Rachel

Buy tickets at the special earlybird price of £11. (We are still running free events during the year - the next one will be in March)

title: Movie (foreign/english film) discussion group
description:
• What we'll do
This event is to ascertain if there is enough interest in a movie discussion event. So its similar to a book club but with movies instead.

This event will set the tone for upcoming meetups.

title: Improving your confidence post sepration or divorce
description:
**Confidence can take a knock during a divorce process. Especially if you were the one who was left. At the same time, as your confidence is at its lowest you are being asked to live a whole new life, meet people and eventually even date again. Daunting as this may seem, most people end up being more confident than before!**

Getting your confidence back will be a gradual process and requires effort. The basic psychology is that we want to avoid things we aren’t familiar with. To get confident, you have to feel the fear and anxiety of new actions, embrace it, and move ahead and do them anyway.

In this session Dr Isabelle Hung shares research on ways you can make your confidence grow again including the basic steps to getting there.

title: New approaches to dealing with trauma post separation or divorce
description:
**Going through a separation or divorce can be a hugely stressful experience. It can affect us mentally, physically, and emotionally. Over a prolonged period of time, stress can reduce your happiness and leave your quality of life hanging in the balance. The best way to combat these mental, physical and emotional feelings is to take active steps to prevent and manage stress.**

Paula Ruane is a therapist who deals with trauma and resilience. A school of thought is that the body holds trauma, it is physically affected by stress, and therefore talking is not enough, one also needs to address the physical symptoms that are created by stress.

As one of the UK’s leading stress specialists, Paula has developed effective, unique, and proven stress prevention resilience training programmes for individuals and organisations.

At this event you will learn techniques designed to offer a holistic approach to healing:

* How to reduce stress
* How to return calm in your life
* How to achieve focus and clarity
* How to improve your mental and emotional health

description:

Come hungry, and let's share these little morsels of heaven! We'll split the bill, and each one pay for their own drink.
View menu here: http://goldenphoenixchinatown.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/DimSum-Menu-Jan-18.pdf

title: A STAR IS BORN (STARRING LADY GAGA, BRADLEY COOPER)
description:
Bradley Cooper directs and co-stars in this outrageously love story doomed by shifting fame. Rotten Tomatoes 95% approval, and has amazing rave reviews from critics.

Seasoned musician Jackson Maine discovers -- and falls in love with -- struggling artist Ally. She has just about given up on her dream to make it big as a singer until Jackson coaxes her into the spotlight. But even as Ally's career takes off, the personal side of their relationship is breaking down, as Jackson fights an ongoing battle with his own internal demons.

Watch trailer here: https://youtu.be/nSbzyEJ8X9E
(THE GUARDIAN)
A Star Is Born review – Lady Gaga mesmerises in Streisand's shoes
5 / 5 stars
https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/aug/31/a-star-is-born-review-lady-gaga-bradley-cooper

----

title: Collage workshop with Collage Club London
description:
Hey girls,

For those of you looking for a creative activity, we are planning a collage workshop on Saturday, Aug 17.

“Collage Club will be popping up at the Fentimans Secret Spritz Garden for an afternoon of cutting and sticking in the sunshine this August! Taking inspiration from the Clerkenwell oasis and all the colourful flowers springing up within its walls, guests will rip, snip and paste together beautiful botanical compositions to take home with them.
The workshop will kick off with some super speedy image-making challenges and collaborative collaging before guests get stuck in with mountains of card, magazines, stickers and tape to recreate the garden in paper form.
Tickets include all materials plus a glass or two of Fentimans Rose Lemonade. Delicious cocktails will be available from the bar all afternoon long if you fancy something stronger!”

Price: £11.37 (fees included)

Please make sure book your ticket here until Aug 10th to avoid any disappointment: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/collage-club-x-fentimans-secret-spritz-garden-tickets-66564617563?aff=ebdssbdestsearch

Hope to see you there! Xoxo 🌟

title: The London Dessert Festival
description:
Your London Dessert Festival ticket grants you entry to an unforgettable, immersive sensory experience. But that’s not all. As well as entry to the event, you’ll receive a selection of complimentary welcome goodies, lessons in dessert prep and photography at our #SundaeSchool Lab and samples of cocktails, mocktails and trending desserts.

Brands featuring at the London Dessert Festival will be showcasing a huge range of tempting dishes, with some created exclusively for the eventYou’re promised a wave of sensory experiences, with each one further amping up the sugary hit. That includes designer donuts, ice cream sandwiches, cookie shots, “gravity-defying milkshakes”, and a host of vegan and sugar-free creations too. Wander through four zones – a Frozen Dessert Zone, a Chocolate Zone, a Patisserie Zone, and a very on-trend Vegan Zone – and you’ll find your appetite increasing with every step.

Captivating installations ready to take over the 'gram. Explore new worlds from artists and visionaries and strike a pose against our custom Insta-friendly backdrops. Take a bath full of SPRINKLES engulfed by mouthwatering aromas as you indulge your curiosity and enter an otherworldly festival of imagination.

✨You can use my code MICHELLEA428 to get £5 off your ticket!✨
Click this link to purchase a ticket and select Saturday afternoon- Standard ticket from 3pm- 6:30pm: https://feverup.com/m/75545?utm_source=fever_app_share&utm_medium=plan_detail&utm_campaign=75545_uk

title: Sunday Brunch at Avobar in Soho (UNHOSTED)
description:
Avobar is London’s first all-avocado casual dining concept.

The menu consists of an eclectic mix of some classic dishes with an exciting twist, such as the much beloved avo toasts served on your choice of either sourdough or sweet potato ‘toast’, with toppings including smashed avo served with a homemade coconut labneh, beetroot hummas with feta and many more.

The infamous Avo Bun Burger takes centre stage on the menu, alongside nutritious egg dishes such as green shakshuka, bowls and salads for both eat in and takeaway and a small plates menu which is available in the evenings.

Complimenting the food is a selection of artisan coffees, teas and drinks including beetroot or matcha lattes, smoothies and juices.

Menu- https://static1.squarespace.com/static/599a9f66d7bdcec01049bbab/t/5d1e4011cedf7500010f0132/1562263574643/AVO+menu_all_day_5.5.pdf

description:
Hey everyone!

Another Sunday brunch in one of Kensington’s nicest areas.

“'Aubaine Kensington is tucked away from the main high street shopping, perfect for those wanting to escape its hustle and bustle. The relaxing ambiance makes it a popular spot for quiet lunch dates, long coffee breaks, business meetings, and casual dinners. The terrace seating at the front of the restaurant is perfect for people-watching on a warm summer’s day. Whether it’s a pastry, a light bite or a three-course meal, our freshly prepared food is sure to satisfy.”

title: Sunday Brunch at The Ivy Chelsea Garden
description:
Please note: This event has an RSVP fee of £3.50 to help cover organiser's costs. Be sure you can attend before singing up, because the RSVP fee is nonrefundable.

The Ivy Chelsea Garden: a palatial 275-seater, marble and stone-clad, casual British restaurant and garden located on the sweeping ground floor of an old Georgian freehouse on the King’s Road.

It has – in addition to a bar, a lounge, a cafe and a restaurant – a 3,500 square foot outdoor terrace and paved garden, filled with politely babbling water fountains; sandstone firepits; marble tables; mosaic chairs; and balustrade pergolas covered in creeping wisteria and red rose vine. Which means that whilst you’re kicking back in the Sunday sun, surrounded by West London’s famous towering trees, intermittently ordering dishes like roasted scallops with grilled chorizo and ras el hanout, and blackened cod fillet baked in banana leaf, and subsequently pairing those dishes with local and international wines, beers and cocktails (like the umeshu plum liqueur, crème de figue and whisky barrel bitters-containing ‘Japanese Plum Tree’), you can relax this summer

Menu: https://theivychelseagarden.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/5/2019/07/BRUNCH_PREMIUM_CHELSEA_SUMMER_2-1.pdf

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ivychelsgarden/

Good friends, light fare & fabulous conversation. Come meet the girls for Brunch at The Ivy Chelsea Garden!
