title: Craft Beginners Bargello Embroidery
description:
You may recognise this type of embroidery from your Grandma's home in the 60s, but now it is back! Well, actually it never really left. Bargello is a truly unique form of embroidery as there are both specific stitches and patterns required to make Bargello, Bargello.

During the class you will be introduced to the typical 'Vertical' stitch used throughout all Bargello, and then you'll get your head around the geometric patterns which are also characteristic of Bargello. You'll be stitching in no time, either one of our patterns or your own design, as our tutor is on hand to teach you how to use this unique form of embroidery to design your own unique pattern. Bargello can be used on normal fabric-like needlepoint fabric but we're using plastic canvas so that you can turn your Bargello design into a coaster! Or you can sew them up to create a pencil holder, plant pot, tissue box cover even.

Level:
Beginners

Duration:
2 hours

Do I Need to Bring Anything:
During the lesson you'll start two coasters and receive plenty of wool to finish your creations. You will take home a kit consisting of a total of 4 canvas and the wool and needle you need to complete your coasters.

All our workshops include unlimited tea, coffee and we always have plenty of cake on offer at every workshop and vegan friendly biscuits. If you require gluten free sweet treats please let us know!

Price: £35.50

DISCLAIMER: this event is organised by Tea & Crafting. Please book your ticket on their website https://www.teaandcrafting.co.uk/products/beginners-bargello-embroidery?_pos=1&_sid=87b794038&_ss=r

Limited spaces! First come, first served.

Nearest tubes are Leicester Square and Covent Garden, however we are still only short walk from Tottenham Court Road, Embankment , Charing Cross and Piccadilly Circus.

Directions: We are opposite Fire & Stone, and above Condesa. To enter our venue please walk down the small pathway called "Bull Inn Court" which is on the right of Condesa (assuming you are facing Condesa). There is a bright blue door and a buzzer labelled Tea & Crafting. Just press it and we'll buzz you in.

title: EASY WALK Seven Sisters from Eastbourne (Country Park Trail)
description:
This has to be one of the most exciting and surprising places in England. The Seven Sister Cliffs are a series of chalk cliffs situated in East Sussex. From the west to east, the seven hills are individually named and occasionally used in filmmaking and TV productions. To get there, we are going to take a bus from Eastbourne to the amazing Seven Sisters Country Park.

Entering into the park, we will walk to the beach along the access trail and enjoy the great views from the top of the cliffs (3 miles walk about 1,30 to 2 hours walk). Please pack your lunch as we will do a 30 min stop to eat along the way.

Getting there: Trains from London Victoria to Eastbourne around 1.30h

Train standard ticket price: around £36.30 any time return. PLEASE BOOK THE TRAIN TICKET IN ADVANCE for the 9:16 train arriving to Eastbourne at 10:46.

Maps:

https://www.sevensisters.org.uk/media/1091/escc-seven-sisters-broadsheet-110618.pdf

You can get a sneak-peak from this video:

https://thewanderingquinn.com/2018/08/visiting-seven-sisters-cliffs-day-trip-london/

Tips for walking long distances:

https://www.livestrong.com/article/232664-tips-on-walking-long-distances/

Prepare your comfy shoes and look forward to see you! 🚶🏻‍♀️🚶🏻‍♀️🚶🏻‍♀️

venue.address: E Dean Rd, East Sussex, Seaford, BN25 4AB

title: Sunday brunch at the Farmacy!
description:
Hey girls!

I’m so excited for this one! Brunch in a stylish healthy eating joint with plenty “free-from” options.

“If Jay Gatsby had fled West Egg for the beaches of Bali, his new home would probably look a lot like west London’s latest health food spot. Farmacy (as in health from the farm, geddit?) is free from most things – dairy, refined sugars, meat, additives and chemical nasties – though happily, not taste. In fact, it’s packed with all kinds of taste, from the food coming out of the kitchen to the ultra-sleek décor. Despite being a vegan-friendly restaurant there is a reassuring lack of hemp, and pretty bamboo is tempered with beautiful brushed gold. It’s smart, to be sure, but the atmosphere is relaxed and the staff are really friendly and, more importantly, not at all stuck-up.”

Check the menu here: https://cdn.shopify.com/s/files/1/0075/5931/5554/files/Brunch_menu_August_2019.pdf?9345

title: OTHERWORLD: An Immersive Virtual Reality Experience
description:
Otherworld is an all-new immersive virtual reality arcade & bar in East London

When you enter the arcade itself – it’s in an old railway arch which they’ve transformed with neon-soaked, cyberpunk details, and filled with cool-looking cylindrical chambers. These are called the ‘immersion rooms’, and we each get our own one. Don’t worry though, you’ll all still be able to hear each other.

Inside they’re rigged with multi-sensory widgets that’ll make everything that little bit more immersive, meaning you’ll be able to “feel the sun beat down on your face as you emerge from the cave, feel the wind in your hair as you slide down a vast mountain and feel the thud beneath your feet of a new land to explore.”

There are 16 games to pick from in total, meaning you can “paint in 3D with light and fire”; dance with lightsabers; climb a full-scale Everest; “stride the earth like a giant” in Google Earth VR; blow up robots with laser cannons in Space Pirate Trainer; fight zombie hordes in Arizona Sunshine; and play a surreal game called Accounting Plus which they apparently “can’t explain”.

After the games, we’ll be able to decompress in the Otherworld bar/restaurant, which has 360 degree art projections animating your surroundings, and a self-serve beer tap pouring house-brew lager. The food all comes from Lords of Poké (and includes poke bowls, Hawaiian pulled-pork tacos, teriyaki sliders, etc.) and the cocktails have all been designed by an ex-Milk & Honey mixologist. And then?

It’s back to reality.

Please book here for Saturday, 5 October at 12:30 PM for 55 minutes (ticket price is £35 but very worth it as this is an experience you can't find anywhere else!!): https://www.other.world/booking/new/4

Website: https://www.other.world
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/otherworld.london/

title: Brunch at Blixen in Old Spitafields Market!
description:
Hey everyone!

Time to grab brunch in one of the most vibrant markets in London, Old Spitafields Market.

“Proudly independent, this all-day brasserie is a dependable alternative to Spitalfields’ pervasive chains – not surprising since it’s co-owned by bright spark Clive Watson (of The Garrison and Village East fame). Fans praise Blixen’s “well-done and good-value” food, as well as its spot-on service and buzzy vibe – whether you’re in the light, airy dining room or the rustic wood-toned basement bar. One regular also likes the ‘secret garden’ for a quick lunch. The cooking is broadly European, moving from pea and wild garlic soup or scallop crudo with radish and poppy seeds to robust mains of corn-fed chicken with roasted Jerusalem artichoke and chicken jus or pork belly with spätzle, kale and quince. To round things off, we like the sound of the banana and caramel pudding with coconut sorbet. Brunch, daytime snacks and Sunday roasts lure the crowds, while drinks encompass house sodas, smoothies, locally brewed beers and some “OK” wines.”

The table is booked for 6 people from 13 pm and I’ll be there just before. If you can’t attend, please make sure to cancel 24-48 hours in advance to allow other to attend.

Check the brunch menu on their website: http://blixen.co.uk

Closest tube station: Aldgate East Station (District Line) or Liverpool Station (Central Line)

Looking forward to see you there! Xoxo

title: Hidden City - Moriarty’s Game: The professor’s invitation
description:
STEP INTO THE WORLD OF SHERLOCK HOLMES

A TREASURE HUNT-STYLE EXPERIENCE ACROSS LONDON, GUIDED BY YOUR PHONE

Sherlock’s mortal enemy, Professor James Moriarty, invites you to celebrate the finest minds in London by solving his mysterious challenge, which he has personally prepared. Succeed, and he promises to make you an offer you can’t refuse…

For the price you get:

A 3-4 hour immersive experience across Marylebone, London

Interactive text messages and phone calls with characters in the story

Hands-on physical puzzles for your team to solve

A story that changes with the decisions you make

Interactions with people you meet, in the real world

Optional breaks in pubs and cafes, where you can pick up refreshments

The RSVP fee includes the price of the ticket £12.50 as well as the usual £3 fee.

I did the Cheshire Cat one a few years ago by the same company and absolutely loved it! The tickets are actually £25 per person, which is a lot of money for a scavenger hunt even if it is worth it, so I decided to book for less people but have more players. If we have enough we can split into two teams to make it even more competitive. I think the only issue would be with the prizes at the end, which was the only let down tbh so I doubt anyone would be too upset to go without…or we could share ;)

title: Dabbers Social Bingo @ Houndsditch
description:
Join me at Dabbers Social Bingo for an afternoon of fun.

We trade frills for thrills in this excitingly fierce game. Gone are the sing-a-longs and dance offs, as the numbers take centre stage with rapid fire calls. In each of the show’s three games, you’ll dab through 45 balls to one line and then a full house for an array of fancy prizes.

If your dabbing hand is nimble you might just be the first to dab off the ‘Express Box’, an extra box in which we give you the chance to play for a super fresh and flashy bonus – but only if you answer our host’s tricky brainteaser correctly.

Whether you’re a seasoned player or a fledgling dabber, it’s all to play for and anyone could win.

We can order food and drinks from [their menu](https://dabbers.bingo/uploads/Brunch-Menu-APR-2022-1.pdf) if we get a little peckish, and they have a [nice range of cocktails](https://dabbers.bingo/uploads/Shuck-Shack-Cocktail-Menu-Talker.pdf) like the Bitch Please! and the Sugar Daddy.

There is a **non-refundable fee** of £13 to confirm your place. (£3 to cover paypal/organiser fees and £10 for the ticket). If you need to cancel, please find someone to take your place, and let me know at least **48h** before the reservation.

title: War of the Worlds: Award Winning Immersive Experience
description:
Join me at the [War of the Worlds Immersive Experience.](https://thewaroftheworldsimmersive.com/?--&gclid=Cj0KCQjwuO6WBhDLARIsAIdeyDJOA0CO7iy3b_QcIX63vaAJ1ywo2IKEwX3oCdpEB_J9YVS8Axccd4UaAlShEALw_wcB) based on the HG Wells book and soundtracked by Jeff Wayne ([Watch the trailer here](https://youtu.be/KMVT0zWmuNk) )

STEP INTO A REAL MARTIAN INVASION
Get ready for a completely unique multi-sensory experience that transports you back to 1898 to experience a Martian invasion.

Live actors guide you through 24 interactive scenes enhanced with virtual reality and multi-sensory effects – all set to Jeff Wayne’s iconic score.

- See the first cylinder land from Mars

- Sneak into a Victorian house

- Escape London by boat

- See Martian forces attack Parliament and Big Ben

- Slide down the claw of a Martian Handling Machine

- Fly to Mars in a hot air balloon

You’ll meet a cast of 17 characters played by 12 live actors and a mix of holograms, projections and virtual reality featuring West End star Carrie Hope Fletcher (Cinderella, Heathers, Les Miserables, Jeff Wayne’s The War of The Worlds Arena Tours) as Beth, The Parson’s Wife, Tom Brittney (Grantchester, Make Me Famous) as George Herbert, The Journalist and Anna-Marie Wayne (The War of The World’s Alive on Stage!) as Carrie, The Journalist’s Wife.

As this is an immersive experience, across two floors, we recommend you wear comfortable clothing and flat trainers or shoes. High heels, flip flops or similar are not suitable and the team reserve the right to refuse entry for health and safety reasons.

Please note:
**This event is Non-refundable. £40 goes towards the ticket and £3 for Paypal/ Organiser fees.**

title: 🏄🏻‍♀️ Paddleboarding for Charity and Afternoon Social 💃🏻
description:
Join me for paddleboarding to end the weekend!

After attending a paddleboarding session with Planet Patrol in April, and a charity paddleboarding session fundraising for Coppa Feel in June, we are joining The London Stand Up Paddle Co. again for **a paddleboarding session for charity, with 100% of the fundaraised amount going to Coppa Feel, an organisation for breast cancer awareness**. You can read more about it here: https://www.standuppaddle.london/city-gals-coppafeel-sessions

This will be such a fun experience and for a very good cause!

The paddleboarding session will have a total duration of 1 hour and will end at around 2 pm. After the session, we will play it by ear and decide how to spend the rest of the afternoon together, to spend time together and wind down. There are many options we can choose from around Richmond riverside!

To attend, you have to be able to swim 50 meters clothed. The equipment included is: paddleboard, paddle, leash, buoyancy aid.

Swimsuit and/or wetsuit not required. Leisure wear recommended. Although this may not happen, be prepared to the idea you may fall in the water! You will have to sign a waiver provided by The London Stand Up Paddle Co., and the link will be provided ahead of the session.

For more information about the sessions, what's provided by The London Stand Up Paddle Co., and what are the ability requirements, **read the information at this link**: https://www.standuppaddle.london/city-gals-coppafeel-sessions

£3 registration fee
£35 paddleboarding session ticket donation
£38 Total payment

\*PLEASE NOTE THAT ANY DEPOSIT PAID IN ADDITION TO THE £3 RSVP FEE AS WELL AS THE £3 RSVP FEE WILL NOT BE REFUNDABLE FROM THE GROUP IF YOU CANCEL OR DO NOT ATTEND\*

AS THIS IS A CHARITY EVENT, **WE WILL NOT ALLOW ANY SUBSTITUTE TO TAKE YOUR SPOT** AND IF ANY RSVP IS CANCELLED, **ANY FURTHER AMOUNT PAID TO SAVE ADDITIONAL SPOTS WILL GO TO THE COPPA FEEL FUNDRAISER**.

£3 RSVP FEE IS NOT REFUNDABLE.

You can see the link to the fundraiser towards which any additional amount will be donated at this link: https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/leianae-jones
You can also see the donations made from previous paddle boarding sessions at the same link :)

I already purchased all tickets and the donation has already been made, your payment will cover the amount I advanced for each individual donation to save the spot.

Hope to see you there :)

title: Practice playing tunes & improvising
description:
We will have 4 hours of practice time from 7pm-11pm. Attendees will be split into two groups, Group 1 practicing from 7pm-9 and Group 2 from 9pm-11pm. In the studio there is a piano, drum kit, base and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones. Onsite there is also a cool restaurant/bar whenever you need a break for refreshments. We could even hang out there after practice if anyone is up for it.

When you arrive at the site it will look like you're going into a restaurant - don't be confused by this, just go through and ask to be directed to the music studios.

To make the best use of our time and so that we are all on the same page, please arrive on time, come prepared, practice and experiment improvising on these three jazz standards (which we will play together on the day):

1) Blue Bossa (C minor Concert Key), sample backing track:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPccy7b1Gtk

It's an instrumental but singers are more than welcome to scat over it, we could even try harmonising like what this singer does:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OlXlptPVlq0

2) Autumn Leaves (in G minor Concert Key) Sample backing track:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C54FdJT3V84&feature=youtu.be

3) My One & Only Love (in key of Concert C). Sample backing track:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5XJhl18oxM

4) Beautiful Love (Concert Key D minor). Sample backing track:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y8zk3YgKoJU

You can find all the sheet music for the above here: https://www.swiss-jazz.ch/partitions-real-book.htm

Please arrive on time with your instrument and your sheet music/chord changes for the above (if you need it). There will likely be a cash contribution of between £5-7 pounds on the day to cover the cost of hiring the studio with equipment.

thank you & hope to see you there !

hanan xx

title: 2nd Practice Session - Latin Rhythms
description:
Hi Everyone,

If you attended the first practice session you will notice that the practice tunes are the same for the 2nd session and this is to offer more opportunity to those of you who wish to perfect/improve on their command of the same standards. The only difference is that we will experiment with playing some of the tunes using different rhythms and tempos (such as afrocuban and samba). In these cases I will support the drum kit player with congas and the clave. Exploring latin jazz and experimenting with different rhythms will ensure we don't get bored practicing the same tunes again !. We will also practice improving on the introductions and conclusions for each tune.

As before - we will have 4 hours of practice time from 7pm-11pm. Attendees will be split into two groups, Group 1 practicing from 7pm-9 and Group 2 from 9pm-11pm. In the studio there is a piano, drum kit, base and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones. When you arrive at the site it will look like you're going into a restaurant - don't be confused by this, just go through and ask to be directed to Studio no. 2.

Here are the tunes to practice for the 2nd session. For each tune, you'll find a sample improv/suggestion for intended tempo and rhythm in addition to a sample backing track:

1) Blue Bossa (C minor Concert Key). To be practiced Afrocuban style:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QRN88c-9GtY (sample improv)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AeDvTebiIhc (sample backing track)

2) Autumn Leaves (in G minor Concert Key) . To be practiced as a Samba:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kVJAc3nxhqY (sample improv)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0eOJxnB3Ok (sample backing track but in swing as I could not find one in a samba)

3) My One & Only Love (in key of Concert C). To be practiced as a Ballad.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W5XJhl18oxM (sample backing track)

4) Beautiful Love (Concert Key D minor). To be practiced as a fast Swing:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ccqW1xHKZA4 (sample backing track)

I created this dropbox location for you to access the sheet music in the correct ConcertKeys: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/0kyh9krngmu3tez/AACu9VPAYpVVxn6hTipdTXvAa?dl=0 ­

Alternatively you can use this resource: https://www.swiss-jazz.ch/partitions-real-book.htm

Pls let me know if you need any help/have any questions related to this event.

There is a contribution of £6 pounds to cover the cost of hiring the studio with equipment.

thank you & hope to see you there !

hanan xx

Organiser (Beginners' Jazz Improv Sessions)

title: 3rd Practice Session-Funky & Latin Jazz
description:
Hi Everyone,

For our third session I thought to move away from the tunes practiced for previous sessions. Even though we have not perfected those previous tunes yet, I think it’s good to take a break from the old and to experiment with funkier more up beat and non-traditional jazz tunes. Please however don’t completely forget the older tunes – as the aim is to eventually get back to them and to improve our performance of everything we practice.

As before - we will have 4 hours of practice time from 2:30pm to 6:30pm. Attendees will be split into two groups, Group 1 practicing from 2:30-4:30pm and Group 2 from 4:30-6:30pm. When you RSVP, please state your instrument and whether you have a preference for a slot and I will do my best to place you according to your preference. If you have paid via paypal and it turns out you can only attend the slot of your choice and I am unable to place you according to your preference – I will of course refund you right away.

In the studio there is a piano, drum kit, base and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones. When you arrive at the site it will look like you're going into a restaurant - don't be confused by this, just go through and ask to be directed to Studio no. 2.

Here are the tunes to practice for the 3rd session. The first two are by one of the biggest names in latin and funky jazz Paquito D’Rivera, and the third tune one is by the great jazz composer Dave Brubeck. As these are all instrumental, singers are invited to scat over them. If there is time, we could try to create/improvise an additional fourth tune together at the end or play one of our previous tunes.

1) Chucho (minor blues – mambo)

original recording: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DtyvJvsmaMg

Small band performance: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lfX7fXbF894

Backing track for your practice: https://www.dropbox.com/s/s9yh3g079nd54rs/Chucho%20%28Minor%20Blues%29_Backingtrack.m4a?dl=0

2) Gdansk (latin Jazz funk):

Original recording: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=utdtEwVDPsc

Small band performance: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHsI30pa204

Backing track for your practice: https://www.dropbox.com/s/gu5ojjvlcw3knfm/Gdansk_BackingTrack.m4a?dl=0

3) Take Five: Eb minor, 5/4 quintuple time

original recording: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PHdU5sHigYQ

backing track: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P2KuJCZuEso

I created this dropbox location for you to access the sheet music in the appropriate key. Where possible I have provided the sheet music for Concert Key instruments, Bflat instruments, E flat instruments and Bass Cleft. https://www.dropbox.com/sh/0kyh9krngmu3tez/AACu9VPAYpVVxn6hTipdTXvAa?dl=0 ­

The most important parts are those for the rhythm section (the base, piano and drums), so if you play any of those instruments, please ensure you practice as much as possible before the session so that you can provide the support needed for the other instruments. Pls let me know if you need any help/have any questions related to this event or even to specific instrument parts.

There is a contribution of £6 pounds (via paypal) to cover the cost of hiring the studio with equipment.

thank you & hope to see you there !

hanan xx

Organiser (Beginners' Jazz Improv Sessions)

title: 5th Jazz Practice & Jam Session- Jazz Style Medley
description:
Hi Everyone,

Thankfully I will be returning to London soon, so we can have one more rehearsal/jam session before the New Year ! I realise it's the holidays and many of you may already be travelling BUT if you're around please join us !.

As before, in this session we will have 4 hours of practice/jam time from 7pm to 11pm. Attendees will be split into two groups, Group 1 practicing from 7-9pm and Group 2 from 9-11pm. When you RSVP, please state your instrument and whether you have a preference for a slot and I will do my best to place you according to your preference.

In the studio there is a piano, drum kit, base and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones.

Here are the tunes to prepare for the 5th session. The list is a good combo of different styles/genres of jazz, all feasible for beginners, and fun to play. All of the tunes also have lyrics for singers apart from ‘Gdansk’ - so singers please join us !

Where possible I have provided the sheet music above for Concert Key instruments, B flat instruments, E flat instruments and Bass Cleft.

For all the previous sessions the contribution per person was £6 pounds, however I always ended up paying extra from my pocket to cover the cost of the studio & equipment hire - since on average 10 participants would show up (and this did not cover the average hire cost of £115). I've therefore had to increase the contribution to £10 to ensure this does not happen - this contribution would allow us to continue going forward, and hopefully it's not too much to ask :

thank you & hope to see you there !

hanan xx

Organiser (Beginners' Jazz Improv Sessions)

title: Resuming Practice Sessions - Jazz Style Medley
description:
Hi Everyone

Happy New Year ! and finally getting ready for our next practice/jam session.

For first timers: this group's meetups are designed as jazz jam/practice sessions in professional rehearsal studios without an audience. We are all beginners and amateur musicians seeking a safe/supportive space to practice with others. We simply agree ahead of time to practice some tunes, then we get to gether and practice playing them together and learn from each other in the process. The idea is to provide a encouraging/professional space for all of us to play music together, and to improve with time till we are confident enough to perform in public.

As in previous meetups, in this event we will have 4 hours of practice/jam time from 7pm to 11pm. Attendees will be split into two groups, Group 1 practicing from 7-9pm and Group 2 from 9-11pm. When you RSVP, please state your instrument and whether you have a preference for a time slot and I will do my best to place you according to your preference. In the studio there will be a piano, drum kit, base and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones. A contribution of £8.50 made by each participant is to cover the cost of hiring the studio along with all the professional equipment in it and none of it goes in my pocket as the organisation is an entirely voluntary activity on my part.

Here are the tunes to prepare for the coming session. The list is a good combo of different styles/genres of jazz, all feasible for beginners, and fun to play. All of the tunes also have lyrics for singers apart from ‘Gdansk’ - so singers please join us !

1. Blue bossa by Kenny Dorham (Bossanova in C minor concert key):

One example rendition of the tune as a bossa: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=be9sYE0BTB8 (http://meet.meetup.com/wf/click?upn=pEEcc35imY7Cq0tG1vyTtxGQuRNzBhUp5L0moh8u5X9vhHj03HcSWBO8hBHhtcyWM3Z32eboadwoCBYZMx9b5A-3D-3D_utxmPxMmyijYYRWunz-2Bk0GDTLFMwzZPsYI7gJX51P2dfvKlCvClrGM8p8Gv2aEfpyh7b3J7C5QOmg6DryNO8WdFYwP8RIMFtdUvT4oAhda28OJw3H32p3m4Vs-2Fuz6bkVTYM1gYzEqvsg7G8ZXnLIh7L4e2Wd-2FeNKY6RR-2BuAWbJFssSmMk-2F8Gb0XonjvdFPa7J37b8BfzRNY627YsfpDRuZY4IeIgeioF9f8SJCZF7pg-3D)

title: 7th Jazz Practice & Jam Session- Jazz Style Medley
description:
Hi Everyone,

In the 7th session we will continue practicing/perfecting the same tunes as in session 6. As always we will have 4 hours of practice/jam time from 7pm to 11pm. Attendees will be split into two groups, Group 1 practicing from 7-9pm and Group 2 from 9-11pm. When you RSVP, please state your instrument and whether you have a preference for a slot and I will do my best to place you according to your preference. In the studio there is a piano, drum kit, base and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones. A contribution of £8.50 made by each participant is to cover the cost of hiring the studio along with all the professional equipment in it and none goes to the organiser as it is an entirely voluntary meetup group.

Here are the tunes to review/perfect. The list is a good combo of different styles/genres of jazz, all feasible for beginners, and fun to play. All of the tunes also have lyrics for singers apart from ‘Gdansk’ - so singers please join us !

1) Blue bossa by Kenny Dorham (Bossanova in C minor concert key): One example rendition of the tune as a bossa:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=be9sYE0BTB8

• Bossa backing track for your practice (150bpm):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7H7Xg6U7P5g

• If you’re feeling brave check out this afrocuban style rendition:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9D-7IdWYndE

• You can also practice it in afrocuban style with this backing track:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AeDvTebiIhc

• Sheet music and lyrics: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/2nc0kkj3xxxxjws/AAB_rcCgx_twoF4rNvVf_xhva?dl=0

It would be awesome if we can perfect playing Blue Bossa both as a bossa and as a afrocuban salsa

2. Autumn Leaves by Joseph Kosma (Medium Swing in G minor Concert Key):

• One beautiful rendition as a swing:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4c3a1VL9894

• Medium Swing backing track for your practice (150bpm):

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0eOJxnB3Ok

• Here’s another beautiful rendition of the tune but as funk soul:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JXw6MtwhwDc

maybe we could try this tune as both a medium swing and as a funky soul tune?

• Sheet music and lyrics: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/0h3il9qazzaevqn/AAAeXnu-IQHiS70xFtSUs3Gja?dl=0

3. Gdansk by Paquito Rivera (Funky Latin tune in D minor concert key):

• Original Rendition:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=utdtEwVDPsc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NHsI30pa204

4. Work song by Natt Adderley (Funky blues tune in F minor):

• Original Rendition:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MmwsQ_dHrFM

Backing track for your practice:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=or0IlXTmFiY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dr7ZFvtLNJY

title: 9th Jazz Practice & Jam Session- 1st Casual Recording
description:
Hi Everyone,

In the 9th session we will experiment for the first time with recording some of the tunes we've been rehearsing together. It will be the same set as the last time (I'm listing the set again below). The recording will be amateurish using a handheld camera with mic so please come prepared as much as you can. Our main challenges to date has been learning to play in tune and in time as a group and coordinating/agreeing on: (1) how to begin a tune, (2) how to improvise within it and (3) how to end it in a synchronised uninterrupted fashion. In my previous email I shared some notes/suggestions for overcoming these challenges for the tunes concerned. If you intend to attend this meetup - please refer to that last email. Alternatively, you can access the suggested practice notes again here : https://www.dropbox.com/s/15uq49xwm3dxi9r/PracticeNotes_1.docx?dl=0

Here is a reminder of the tunes to prepare:
1) Blue Bossa (in Concert C minor)
2) Autumn Leaves (in Concert G minor)
3) Work Song (In Concert F Minor)
4) Gdansk (in Concert D Minor)

You can access the relevant sheet music (available for all instruments) in this location:

https://www.dropbox.com/home/BeginnersJamSessions

As usual will have 4 hours of practice/jam time from 7pm to 11pm. If more than 6 people sign up to the event, registrants will be split into two groups. Group 1 practicing from 7pm-9pm and Group 2 from 9pm-11pm. When you RSVP, please state your instrument and whether you have a preference for a slot and I will do my best to place you according to your preference. If only a small number sign up you are welcome to attend one or both sessions to maximise benefit from practice time.

In the studio there is a piano, drum kit, base and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones. A contribution of £8.50 made by each participant is to cover the cost of hiring the studio along with all the professional equipment in it and none goes to the organiser as it is an entirely voluntary meetup group.

thank you & hope to see you there !

hanan xx

Organiser (Beginners' Jazz Improv Sessions)

title: Open Jazz Practice/Jam session - Always Welcoming Newcomers!
description:
Hi Everyone,

Regardless of your level of musicianship/confidence - please join us in this event ! All our events offer casual/fun opportunities for anyone who sings or plays an instrument to rehearse with others in a relaxed environment and meet new people!

Our next rehearsal/jam session is set for afternoon of Sunday 20th May, from 2:30pm. You can either join the 2:30 or the 4:30 group and practice with us for two hours. title: Learn from a Professional Jazz Musician
description:
Hi everyone,

This event is a hands-on 2 hour educational session lead by Adam Dyer, a professional jazz musician. Takes place Studio 3, The Premises, Sat 2nd June promptly at 2:30pm. It will be the first event of this type where we invite a professional musician to be our guide.

Using the same tunes we've been playing, Adam will provide us tips on areas such as improvisation, accompaniment and rhythm - so that we can sound more cohesive together and closer to a performing standard.

***A short bio on our teacher***:
Adam Dyer is a graduate of the Guildhall School of Music, and a professional jazz pianist and teacher. He has performed with well known jazz musicians such as Bobby Wellins (at the London Jazz Festival), Dan Berglund and Gregory Porter (at the Stockholm Jazz Festival), and is a regular at Ronnie Scott's. He has also played jazz/classical crossover projects with the likes of the Southbank Sinfonia and has featured live in concert with the Guildhall Big Band on BBC Radio 3.

This is a great opportunity for anyone looking to learn and places are limited to max 10 participants to enable smooth running of the workshop - so please sign up soon if interested. **(Please note however that we can only take one player for each of these instruments: base, piano, drums, electric guitar. If multiple sign up, the additional players will be refunded immediately)** The studio will have a piano, a drum kit, 1 guitar amp & 1 base amp, enough mics, stands and chairs for all.

The higher than usual price goes to paying for the studio & equipment hire along with the teacher's fee.

Below I list the tunes along with sample backings tracks once more so you can practice ahead of time:

1) Blue Bossa (in Concert C minor)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7H7Xg6U7P5g
2) Autumn Leaves (in Concert G minor)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E0eOJxnB3Ok
3) Work Song (In Concert F Minor)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=or0IlXTmFiY
4) Gdansk (in Concert D Minor)
https://www.dropbox.com/s/gu5ojjvlcw3knfm/Gdansk_BackingTrack.m4a?dl=0
5) How high the moon (in Concert G major)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hxtLS4t9jP0

All relevant sheet music for these tunes (for all instruments) accessible in this location:
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/0kyh9krngmu3tez/AACu9VPAYpVVxn6hTipdTXvAa?dl=0

Hope to see you there!

Hanan & Zee
Co-organisers of Beginners Jazz Jam

title: Workshop and potential Jam at the Hideaway - Blue Bossa
description:
For anyone who has been to one of the jams, you'll have had a go at playing Blue Bossa - a very popular jazz standard. This is an exciting opportunity to get some tips on playing this song, and if you're comfortable, playing it in front of an audience!

The Hideaway in Streatham runs a weekly jazz workshop and jam session - on June 18th the workshop will focus on Blue Bossa. You can find more details here - http://www.hideawaylive.co.uk/jazz-workshops

In addition, those who wish can also play in the jam afterwards - so we may have a chance of performing this song to an audience, for many of us perhaps for the first time!

To prepare for the jam session, there will also be a practice session (at the usual venue, the Premises) the day before on June 17th so that we can get a good amount of practice.

Note that the Hideaway charges £10 for the workshop, but playing at the jam is free. The workshop begins promptly at 7.30pm and the jam at 9.30pm.

Hope to see many of you there!
With love,

Hanan and Xie

description:

title: Next practice Jam Session, New comers Always Welcome !
description:
Hi Everyone,

Regardless of your level of musicianship/confidence - please join us in this event ! All our events offer casual/fun opportunities for anyone who sings or plays an instrument to rehearse with others in a relaxed environment and meet new people!

This rehearsal is set for the morning of Saturday 7th July from 10am. We will have two groups of people rehearsing. You will be allocated to either the 10am group or the 12pm group and practice with us for two hours. To avoid confusion allocation will from now on be left to the discretion of the organisers who will assess total number of people & instruments registered, ensure there is a good balance of instruments in each group, and announce the allocations nearer the date.

These are the tunes we're trying in the next session:

1). Autumn Leaves in a different key (this time will try playing this one in Concert A minor ), and maybe we could attempt it as a samba ?

2). Midnight Mambo - this is a great latin tune by oscar hernandez , awesome beat with only 3 key chords so should make improvising fun and hopefully easy ! You can find the score for concert C instruments in this dropbox location: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/yr70qxkc71znxg9/AACnP_x-HdU7xEdm8C3pnFvna?dl=0
Other instruments would need to transpose or learn by ear from the recording. One good version of it is here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NmR19DJ-fVs

3) C Jam Blues: this is a 12-bar blues tune with a straightfoward melody. Learning how to play a blues tune means you can apply the same skills across the numerous other songs that share the same form.
hers a cool version of it with Ella Fitzgerald scatting: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=osI1QoRgxiU

Feel free to practice the tunes before coming and if needed bring sheet music with you (IMP!: we don't provide print outs).

When you RSVP, please state your instrument. We can only take a max of two base players, two pianists , two drummers, and 4 guitar players. Once we reach the max for these we cannot take any more registrants.

Once enough people have registered you will receive an email confirmation of your placement/slot.

In the studio there is a piano, drum kit, bass and guitar amps, enough stands, and microphones. A contribution of £10 made by each participant is to cover the cost of hiring the studio along with all the professional equipment in it .

with love,

Co-organisers Hanan & Xie

title: Next Jam Session, Everyone Welcome!
description:
**RSVPs are closed, but message me if you'd like to join**

**everyone should have received a message if your slot, if not let me know**

Hi Everyone,

Regardless of your level of musicianship or confidence - please come along! These are opportunities for anyone who sings or plays an instrument to rehearse with others in a relaxed environment.

**Logistics**

Please note change of venue, we're going to be at the Brixton Hill Studios (Studio 1)

Slot 1: 1.30pm - 3.30pm (set up from 1.15pm)
Slot 2: 4pm - 6pm (set up from 3.45pm)

A slot will be allocated based on balance of instruments, and sent out closer to the date. If you cannot make one of the slots, feel free to state this - if this cannot be accommodated you will be given a refund.

Note we can only take a max of one pianist, two bass players, two drummers, and 4 guitar players.

**Tunes**

1). Gdansk. This latin tune is not too difficult to play but a lot of fun. You can find the lead sheet here https://www.dropbox.com/sh/2ecrfwy8xircuin/AAByKmOr5gY90eV498FDotsFa?dl=0

2). Blue Monk in Bb. Learning to play the blues is a versatile and important skill!

3) Caravan in F-. This song, of whiplash fame, does not have a complex chord progression so it's a great opportunity to work on your improvisation

4) On Green Dolphin Street in C. A jazz classic - and a more challenging tune with modal changes and a fairly complexity form

You'll make the most of the session if you practice beforehand! Feel free to make use of youtube tutorials and practice with backing tracks. (The app iReal pro is useful for providing backing tracks where you can adjust things like tempo/style.) At the same time don't worry if you feel like you still have a long way to go - we all do! Drop me a note if you're looking for some specific tips.

We won't be providing lead sheets so please bring yours with you if needed.

**Equipment**
In the studio there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones.
If you play the drums you'll need to bring cymbals (or you can pay £8 to rent from the studio)

Look forward to seeing you there!
Xie

title: Social + Trinity Laban Jazz Orchestra Showcase
description:
Several of you have asked for another social get together, and what better occasion than during the London Jazz Festival! Here's the plan:

- Meet at 17.00 at the Royal Festival Hall, just inside the doorways next to the Nelson Mandela statue (will wait until 17.15 - send me a message if you can't find us)

- Head down for the Trinity Laban Jazz Orchestra Showcase (starting at 17.45). The event is free, performed by students at Trinity Laban, and also featuring Mercury Prize nominated trumpeter Laura Jurd

- Once this has finished we'll head over to the pub, Fountain & Ink (SE1 9LY) 10 mins walk away. Not sure when exactly this will be (maybe around 8), but feel free to meet us there if you're only free later on. They are known for good pizzas and according to Google not too busy on Saturdays.

Any questions just let me know. If you want to find out where we are on the day drop me a message on Meetup (not as a comment on the event as I can't get notifications for those).

See you then,
Xie

venue.address: Royal Festival Hall, Southbank Centre, SE1 8XX

Group 3B: 4pm - 6pm (set up from 3.45pm)

title: Intermediate Practice Jam - May 25th
description:
update: open for all instruments

Trying out a new format - like the familiar pub/bar jam, everyone can call songs they'd like to play...

- A chance to focus on more nuanced aspects of playing - listening, responding, communicating, building the sound together
- Discussion and feedback encouraged
- Attendee numbers limited so everyone gets plenty of playing time
- Assumes basic ability to follow the form / accompany / improvise, and caters to those who are looking to challenge themselves beyond that
- Usual relaxed friendly vibe

Please sign up before attending

**Tunes**
Any tune you like, as long as it's familiar enough for the rhythm section to accompany you! Also best to assume you need to play the head, especially if it's not a well known tune...

**Equipment**
In both studios there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (or can be rented for £8)

Look forward to it and feel free to get in touch with any questions
Xie

title: Intermediate Practice Jam - June 8th
description:
Update - full for drums, piano, guitar, brass/woodwind

Thanks for all you pioneers for coming along for the new session last week! It was fun but challenging as we're learning what works best. Do send along any other feedback.

I've made some changes to try to make the session a better experience for the group:

* Length: expanded the session to 4.5 hours. You're not obliged to stay for the whole session, but if you're drums or bass (i.e. the most important!) do let me know if you can only make a part of it
* Level: as a rough guide, you'd be expected to have played 30+ jazz standards, and near a point where you no longer need sheet music for at least a few songs
* Calling songs: choose most of your songs from top 100/200 most commonly called jazz tunes
e.g. https://www.facebook.com/notes/the-jazz-workshop/the-top-200-jazz-tunes-everyone-should-know/366418443479460/
or
https://www.hopestreetmusicstudios.com/articles/100-must-know-jazz-tunes
You're free to choose from outside them, but if many others haven't even heard the song we may skip to another
* Also, if you're calling a song, ideally you know it like the back of your hand and are familiar with at least a few recorded versions
* Singers: please know what key you'd like to call a song in

If you're not sure you'd get much out of the session, just drop me a note or come say hi at one of then setlist jams.

As before:

We're trying out a new format - like the familiar pub/bar jam, everyone can call songs they'd like to play.

- A chance to focus on more nuanced aspects of playing - listening, responding, communicating, building the sound together
- Discussion and feedback encouraged
- Attendee numbers limited so everyone gets plenty of playing time
- Assumes basic ability to follow the form / accompany / improvise, and caters to those who are looking to challenge themselves beyond that
- Usual relaxed friendly vibe

Please sign up before attending

**Equipment**
In both studios there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (or can be rented for £8)

Look forward to it and feel free to get in touch with any questions
Xie

- Usual relaxed friendly vibe

If you're not sure you'd get much out of the session, just drop me a note or come say hi at one of then setlist jams.

Please sign up before attending

**Equipment**
In both studios there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (or can be rented for £8)

Look forward to it and feel free to get in touch with any questions
Xie

title: Setlist Jam - July 20
description:
Look forward to seeing many of you again for our setlist sessions. It's a chance to prepare, rehearse and jam over a changing set of jazz standards with others in a relaxed environment, and have fun! New members very welcome

Please sign up before attending

You'll be allocated a group to start at 11am, 1.15pm or 3.45pm, by Thursday before the session. If you can't make any of the sessions please message me _before_ you sign up. Also let me know if you haven't received your group by Thursday - some people don't receive group messages.

**Logistics**
Group A: 11am - 1.15pm
Group B: 1.15pm - 3.30pm
Group C: 3.45pm - 6.00pm

A 2 hour group will be allocated for each attendee based on balance of instruments. I try to place more proficient players in earlier groups.

**Tunes**
All of me in C (warm up)
Só Danço Samba in C
All Blues in G
Just Friends in G
Watermelon Man in F

We will follow the form on the iReal Pro app. Melodies, lyrics and sources of inspiration can be found on real books, youtube, spotify etc.

Singers / horn players - generally you are in charge of playing the heads (main melody) of the songs.

Dear singers - if you struggle to find lyrics for a song, you might have better luck finding vocal versions on youtube (and sometimes you'll even find lyrics in the comments).

**Equipment**
In both studios there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (or can be rented for £8)

Looking forward to it and feel free to get in touch with any questions
Xie

title: Intermediate Jam - July 20
description:
**full for piano, guitar

A chance to focus on more nuanced aspects of playing - listening, responding, communicating, building the sound together! Attendees take turns to call songs for this session.

Please note before signing up:

* I'll assume you can make the full session (1.30pm-6pm), but if not please let me know if you can do either 1.30pm-4pm or 3.30pm-6pm

* Level: as a rough guide, you'd be expected to have played 30+ jazz standards, comfortable following the form / comping / improvising

* Format: like the familiar pub/bar jam, everyone can call songs they'd like to play

* Calling tunes: choose mostly from top 100/200 most commonly called jazz standards
e.g. https://www.hopestreetmusicstudios.com/articles/100-must-know-jazz-tunes
You're free to choose from outside them, but if most others haven't heard/played the song we may skip to another

* If you're calling a song, make sure to know it well and are familiar with at least a few recorded versions

* Singers: please know what key you'd like to call a song in

If you're not sure you'd get much out of the session, just drop me a note or come say hi at one of then setlist jams.

Please sign up before attending

**Equipment**
In both studios there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (or can be rented for £8)

Look forward to it and feel free to get in touch with any questions
Xie

title: Jazz jam in the Park + Pub
description:
Come along for the first outdoor edition of the jam session, out in the glorious London summer...

- Let's meet at 2pm at Clapham Common, on the side near Clapham Common station and just south of Holy Trinity Church. We might move elsewhere but probably still be in the park - I'll post a comment here

- If anyone can bring battery powered keyboards / amplifiers do let me know. So far we'll have 1 drum kit, 1 small bass amp, 1 micro guitar amp. No keyboards or mics at the moment. Bring your music stands

- Free for everyone, all instruments welcome, bring your +1, musician & non musician friends, drinks / food

- Off to one of the numerous pubs in the area afterwards!

title: Novice / setlist | 9am July 30, Vortex upstairs
description:
**update: full for bass, guitar, drums, piano**

full list of scheduled sessions: https://www.meetup.com/Practice-Jazz-Jam-Sessions/events/

**What is it**
a pre-selected set of jazz standards for each session that you can prepare for in advance, and rehearse live with others in a friendly and welcoming environment. See below for this week's setlist.

please sign up before attending

Location: Vortex upstairs

**Who's it for**
anyone who has practised following the forms (chord progressions) of jazz tunes - maybe on their own at home - and would like to build up playing experience, expand repertoire and practice performing with other musicians.

There are various introductions on how jazz jams work - see e.g.
[http://bit.ly/dubjazz](http://bit.ly/dubjazz)
You don't need to get all these details right for these novice practice sessions.

Bass players expected to be able to play a walking bass line on swing tunes, and simple bossa lines for bossa novas.

Eah novice session is limited to up to: 1 drummer, 2 bass, 2 keys, 2 guitar, 4 lead instruments.

**What it's like**
a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere - please put aside any worries of making mistakes if you’re thinking of joining us for the first time

**Tunes this week**
Blue Monk in Bb (warm up)
How Insensitive in Dm
Night and day in C
Softly as in a morning sunrise in Cm

**Tune preview - next novice session, likely 7 Aug 12pm**
Blue bossa in Cm (warm up)
How Insensitive in Dm
What is this thing called love in C
Solar in Cm

**Preparing for the session**
The chordal form of each song follow the iReal Pro app as a common reference, or you can use sheet music from Real Books.

Resource for sheet music:
https://www.seventhstring.com/fbindex.html
http://therealbook.info/

Try to immerse yourself in the songs by listening to recordings by different artists on youtube, spotify etc.

Learn the head (main melody) of the song if you can. Don't hesitate to let the band know you can play it so you can start things off

**Equipment**
there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals or high hat clutch), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (none available for rental) and hi hat clutch

**Vocalists**
singers very welcome though usually I suggest you come to the intermediate sessions where you can pick your own song and key (as chances are many of the above are not in the right key for your range)

any questions do get in touch!

title: Intermediate / funk fusion | 11am July 30, Vortex downstairs
description:
**Update: full for guitar, bass, drums**

Note: please also learn the heads if you're on guitar or piano. There may be no horn players, and even with horn players many well known versions of these songs have guitars, keys or even bass as the lead instrument.

full list of scheduled sessions: https://www.meetup.com/Practice-Jazz-Jam-Sessions/events/

**Song list**

* Grant Green - Ain't It Funky Now (lead sheet https://www.dropbox.com/s/kzizkn5xatodhjh/aint-it-funky-now.pdf?dl=0)
* Walk Tall (Cannonball Adderley)
* Strasbourg St Denis
* Afro blue (e.g. Robert Glasper https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H_hT61-E5kg or https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hyc37lYJGXM
* Work song (e.g. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GoemCfUK6kc)

Feel free to send along suggestions for future sessions, and any feedback on which songs you enjoyed playing (or not so much)

**What is it**
A format focused on funk and fusions tunes.

With a pre-selected set for each session that you can prepare for in advance, and rehearse live with others in a friendly and welcoming environment

please sign up before attending

Location: Vortex downstairs

**Who's it for**
You'd be expected to be comfortable following the form / comping / improvising, and have listened to and practised the tunes ahead of the sessions

**Notes on tunes**
Use iReal Pro app (including forum searches), MuseScore, as well as real books for reference.
You can use this index to see which real book contains specific tunes: [https://www.seventhstring.com/fbindex.html](https://www.seventhstring.com/fbindex.html)

**Equipment**
At the Vortex there is a piano, bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (none available for rental) and hi hat clutch

any questions do get in touch!

title: Intermediate / set + performance | 1-5.30pm July 30, Vortex upstairs
description:
**update: full for all instruments**

**note: Please only sign up if you are available for the full 1-5.30pm.**

1-4pm: rehearsal at Vortex upstairs
5-5.30pm: performance at Vortex downstairs bar.

Note: please ensure you've listened to a few versions of all of these tunes, learning any common motifs and ideally also the melody (even if not lead instrument)

Let me know if you'd like to volunteer to lead the session.

The group will work with their guidance on the overall sound of the ensemble, which songs go in the 30 minute set (typically \~3), and other details such as how to start/end tunes and who will take solos.

full list of scheduled sessions: https://www.meetup.com/Practice-Jazz-Jam-Sessions/events/

**Tunes this week**
(anything easy to warm up)
Lucky Southern
My little suede shoes (with head as per https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CVSpDAaosck)
Four
Maiden Voyage
Nardis

Keys not given - see note below

**Tunes preview - next session likely 11am Aug 13**
(anything easy to warm up)
Maiden Voyage
Bemsha Swing
Take Five
Wave

**What is it**
a pre-selected set of jazz standards for each session that you can prepare for in advance, and rehearse live with others in a friendly and welcoming environment

Songs here will be more challenging than the novice setlist.

The session will conclude with a 30 minute set downstairs at Vortex jazz club. (\~3 tunes)

please sign up before attending

We'll have one of the attendees lead the group - please let me know if you'd like to volunteer for a future session.
location: Vortex upstairs (until 4pm) and Vortex downstairs (5-5.30pm)

**Who's it for**
You are comfortable playing a variety of jazz standards and keen to play some that may be a bit trickier - fast, slow, difficult changes, odd time, specific riffs, mid-song communication etc. Also a chance to discuss after the song and play again.

**What it's like**
a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere - please put aside any worries of making mistakes if you’re thinking of joining us for the first time

**Notes on tunes**
form on the iReal Pro app as common reference (real books OK too). Melodies, lyrics and inspiration from real books, youtube, spotify etc.

If you're keen to play the head, don't hesitate to let the band know - even if you're not on a lead instrument

Keys are not given for intermediate sessions; the group is expected to play in the preferred key of whoever is taking the head. Usually this will match available sheet music and/or well known recordings.

Which real book contains which song: https://www.seventhstring.com/fbindex.html

**Equipment**
there is a piano, drum kit (no cymbals or high hat clutch), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Drummers: please bring cymbals (none available for rental) and hi hat clutch

**Vocalists**
singers very welcome though usually I suggest you get in touch with me (Xie) about joining sessions where you can pick your own song and key (as chances are many of the above are not in the right key for your range)

any questions do get in touch!

title: Intermediate / set with vocals + performance | 1-6pm July 30, Pirate Dalston
description:
**Update: full for bass, vocals, guitar, keys, drums**

**note: Please only sign up if you are available for the full 1-6pm.**

1-5pm: rehearsal at Pirate Dalston (including breaks!)
5.30-6pm: performance at Vortex downstairs bar.

Let me know if you'd like to volunteer to lead the session.
The group will work with their guidance on the overall sound of the ensemble, which 3 songs go in the set, and other details such as how to start/end tunes, who will take solos and trading 4s.

Keys players: please bring your own instrument. There is also a good chance you can get a keyboard from the studio, but this is not guaranteed.

**Tunes**
(instrumental - horns/piano/guitar will be expected to play the melody here)
Isfahan in Db
Rhythm-a-ning in Bb

(+ following tunes where the vocalist will take the melody)
(vocalist: Graham)
Since I fell for you in Eb
Joy Spring in Db

(vocalist: Tamara)
All of me in G
The lady is a tramp in Ab

**What is it**
A new format - play through a longer setlist, paying attention to the collective sound, work with vocalists.

The session will conclude with a 3 song set downstairs at Vortex jazz club.

**Who's it for**
As a rough guide, you'd be expected to be familiar with 30+ jazz standards, be comfortable following the form / comping / improvising.

You are expected to actively listen to the other instruments in the group, playing together rather than as individuals. The group lead will help guide this.

For singers - please contact me if you're interested in coming along for future sessions as vocals tunes will be included in specific keys for you.

New members always welcome

**What it's like**
A relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, free to take risks and finding inspiration and making mistakes along the way. If you are just starting out, you may find the setlist sessions more useful to help build up your repertoire.

**How does it work**
please sign up before attending.

We'll have one of the attendees lead the group - please let me know if you'd like to volunteer for a future session.

location: Pirate Dalston (until 5pm) and Vortex downstairs (5.30-6pm)

**Equipment**
There is a drum kit (do bring cymbals), bass and guitar amps, stands, and microphones. Keyboard available from the spares cupboard but this is not guaranteed.

any questions do get in touch!

title: Chinese（Mandarin, Cantonese）& English Language Exchange 英语交流
description:
理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Chinese（Mandarin, Cantonese）& English Language Exchange 英语交流
description:
Chinese（Mandarin, Cantonese）& English Language Exchange 英语交流

理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

价钱：免费

我们的宗旨：把学习当游戏

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

你可能在想 ”如果我不会任何英文怎么能一起玩？”。我们会在玩每个游戏前会教大家这游戏里必须要用的几句英文。当你立刻和重复用这几句之后你就会明白这几句里面每个字的用意，也代表你不会再忘记了。

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

时间和地点：

周六，8月26号，下午3点 - 5点
Pre A Manger，52-54 Cannon Street, London, EC4N 6LY, Telephone: 020 7932 5266

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) Language Exchange
description:
English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) Language Exchange

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay and Michael

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Chinese（Mandarin, Cantonese）& English Language Exchange 英语交流
description:
Chinese（Mandarin, Cantonese）& English Language Exchange 英语交流

理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

价钱：免费

我们的宗旨：把学习当游戏

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

你可能在想 ”如果我不会任何英文怎么能一起玩？”。我们会在玩每个游戏前会教大家这游戏里必须要用的几句英文。当你立刻和重复用这几句之后你就会明白这几句里面每个字的用意，也代表你不会再忘记了。

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

(中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay and Michael

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay and Michael

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English
description:
Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English

(English intro is shown on our main page: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

价钱：免费

我们的宗旨：把学习当游戏

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

你可能在想 ”如果我不会任何英文怎么能一起玩？”。我们会在玩每个游戏前会教大家这游戏里必须要用的几句英文。当你立刻和重复用这几句之后你就会明白这几句里面每个字的用意，也代表你不会再忘记了。

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

(中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay and Michael

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.
