group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

(中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay and Michael

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English
description:
Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English

(English intro is shown on our main page: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

价钱：免费

我们的宗旨：把学习当游戏

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

你可能在想 ”如果我不会任何英文怎么能一起玩？”。我们会在玩每个游戏前会教大家这游戏里必须要用的几句英文。当你立刻和重复用这几句之后你就会明白这几句里面每个字的用意，也代表你不会再忘记了。

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

*Hi everyone, just wanted to let you know that I will be away for the next three weeks, but I will keep the session running (in the same place at the same time) for our existing members to meet up. If you have never been to our session before, please still come along as our existing members will be there playing various games in Mandarin, Cantonese and English. They are amazing people and will introduce themselves to you when you arrive. There is only one rule! everyone has to speak English in the first hour, and then Chinese in the second hour. This ensures everyone gets to improve on their desired language. In the meantime, sorry I couldn’t be there to meet you all (and for the the possible lack of structure and new games in the sessions), but I look forward to seeing you all again on the 14th of October. Jay

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

你可能在想 ”如果我不会任何英文怎么能一起玩？”。我们会在玩每个游戏前会教大家这游戏里必须要用的几句英文。当你立刻和重复用这几句之后你就会明白这几句里面每个字的用意，也代表你不会再忘记了。

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

*Hi everyone, just wanted to let you know that I will be away for the next two weeks, but I will keep the session running (in the same place at the same time) for our existing members to meet up. If you have never been to our session before, please still come along as our existing members will be there playing various games in Mandarin, Cantonese and English. They are amazing people and will introduce themselves to you when you arrive. There is only one rule! everyone has to speak English in the first hour, and then Chinese in the second hour. This ensures everyone gets to improve on their desired language. In the meantime, sorry I couldn’t be there to meet you all (and for the the possible lack of structure and new games in the sessions), but I look forward to seeing you all again on the 14th of October. Jay

*大家好，想先告诉你们一声，因为旅游的关系，我之后的两个周天都不能带领这个活动。但是，这个活动会继续在同一个地方和时间进行，让我们现有的成员聚会。如果你之前没来过，也一样可以来，因为我们的成员还会在那里玩游戏和聊天，而它们对你也会是无限的欢迎。你一到，它们会尽力跟你自我介绍，把你带入群里。我们只有一条规矩，就是第一个小时所有人要说英语，第二个小时说中文。这样所有人都能学到它们想学的语言。很抱歉，如果因为我的缺席而令到这聚会暂时缺乏结构和游戏上的创新，但我期待着10月14号能见到你们的那一天。Jay

(中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

(中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free (if you bring a board game from home). Otherwise, its £1 (so that we can buy new games for the session)

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

(中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free (if you bring a board game from home). Otherwise, it £1 (so that we can buy new games for the session)

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English
description:

(English intro is shown on our main page: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

价钱：免费（如果你可以从家里带一个棋盘类的游戏），如果没有，没问题，也就是 £1（这是让我们可以为大家购买新的游戏）

我们的宗旨：把学习当游戏

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange @ BOUNCE this week! - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange @ BOUNCE! - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

(What our group is about can be seen here 我们组的中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Hi everyone,

THIS WEEK WE ARE MOVING OUR PARTY TO BOUNCE bar to (coincidentally) celebrate our 2 months anniversary!

https://www.bouncepingpong.com/locations/london/farringdon/

THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO PRESSURE TO DRINK for those who don’t (a lot of us don’t), so its just a awesome place to chill as per usual.

WE STILL HAVE BOARDGAMES, but with the addition of music, (non-coffee shop) disco style lighting, and also 2 TABLE TENNIS TABLES reserved for only us in a semi-private area.

*ADMISSION IS £7 PER PERSON because that is how much it costs to rent the space and the 2 table tennis tables for 2 hours.* (please pay via PAYPAL OR MESSAGE ME if you don’t have PayPal and we can sort it out.)

IF YOU HAVE NEVER JOINED US BEFORE, please still come along because (same as always) we will still come and introduce ourselves to you as you come in, and you will not be the only first-timer here.

Therefore, PLEASE DO NOT GO TO OUR USUAL LOCATION THIS WEEK (which is Pret near Cannon Street) because we won’t be there!

A MASSIVE THANK YOU to all of our members’ support in the past 2 months (especially Steph who has been instrumental to this family’s growth). I look forward to getting thrashed by you all on the table tennis table this Sunday.

大家好！

这周我们将会移动我们的派对到BOUNCE酒吧，来庆祝我们的2个月纪念日！

https://www.bouncepingpong.com/locations/london/farringdon/

我们有很多人都不喝酒的，所以不喝酒的人，没有人会逼你喝酒（有的话跟我说..哈哈说笑的）。所以跟以往一样也只是一个大家聊天玩游戏的地方。

我们还是会有棋盘类游戏。不同的是增加了音乐，迪斯科风格的灯光，还有2张私人乒乓球桌，全在我们订的私人空间里。

*入场费为每人£7，因为这是租用空间和2张乒乓球桌2个小时的费用。*（请用PAYPAL付钱，没有PAYPAL的话请寄个Message给我）

如果你之前没跟我们一起玩过，可以趁这个美好的节日加入我们！并且你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。最重要的是，你不会是唯一一个第一次来的人。

所以这周请不要去我们平常聚会的Pret咖啡店，因为我们不会在那里！

非常感谢过去2个月我们所有成员的支持（尤其是Steph）。我期待着这个星期天在乒乓球桌上跟你们决一胜负。

Jay

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English
description:
Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English

(English intro is shown on our main page: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

价钱：免费（如果你可以从家里带一个棋盘类的游戏），如果没有，没问题，也就是 £1（这是让我们可以为大家购买新的游戏）

我们的宗旨：把学习当游戏

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

你可能在想 ”如果我不会任何英文怎么能一起玩？”。我们会在玩每个游戏前会教大家这游戏里必须要用的几句英文。当你立刻和重复用这几句之后你就会明白这几句里面每个字的用意，也代表你不会再忘记了。

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English
description:
Language Exchange 英语交流 - Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese) & English

(English intro is shown on our main page: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

理念：通过各种游戏上的合作和沟通来自然提升英语水平

价钱：免费（如果你可以从家里带一个棋盘类的游戏），如果没有，没问题，也就是 £1（这是让我们可以为大家购买新的游戏）

我们的宗旨：把学习当游戏

大家好！我叫Jay，从小在英国长大的中国人，所以英语说的很好，可中文就差了一点。我想在伦敦也很多人像你我一样，要不就是想把中文练好然后可以前途无量，要不就是海龟刚到英国，希望可以学好英语令父母骄傲，朋友妒忌（说笑的！）。但说到底，我们都是希望可以学好大家的母语。既然是这样，我们有什么理由不互相帮助呢？

特别的是，我们的做法跟其他语言交流不一样，我们会用玩游戏和做活动的方式来自然提升英语水平。

研究指出通过玩游戏上的合作和沟通来学英语会比两个人坐下来闲聊更容易入脑。因为这能让学习更有结构，而且可以立刻学以至用。

所以我们这里学的快，好玩，而且不会有像闲聊的问题，没有结构，或者有冷场。

你可能在想 ”如果我不会任何英文怎么能一起玩？”。我们会在玩每个游戏前会教大家这游戏里必须要用的几句英文。当你立刻和重复用这几句之后你就会明白这几句里面每个字的用意，也代表你不会再忘记了。

或者你会想 ” 那我每次只能学几句英文？”。我们希望要的是质量而不是数量。当你真正会用12句的时候，你就自然有能力把那12句变成24句，48句，因为你明白那12句里面每个字的用意。

玩不一定需要语言，但是语言是一起玩之后必送的附加礼品。起码这是我们的经历。

就算你好像我刚到英国一样连APPLE都不会拼，九个月之后你也会能像我一样跟外国人打成一片（甚至于英文好到连中文都开始忘记了呵呵）。

我们这里是一个大家庭，大家都会有所建议。我们个人进步的同时，这里也会进步。让大家觉得来这里更有价值，更好玩，更开心。

如果你是第一次来，你一到门我们就会跟你自我介绍，把你带进我们的群里。

再不用担心一开始很难入群，会有冷场，又或者一进门就成了全世界的焦点。

无论是害羞或者慢热，你都会毫无压力而自然的加入我们这家庭里。

希望下次能见到你。

Jay

我们对成员的要求：

想学好英文，为其他成员着想，玩的开心

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)
description:
Language Exchange - English & Chinese (Mandarin, Cantonese)

(中文介绍可以在这里看的到: https://www.meetup.com/Chinese-Mandarin-Cantonese-English-Language-Exchange/events/)

Our goal: To naturally improve verbal communication skills in Mandarin or Cantonese through cooperation in various games and team building exercises.

Price: Free (if you bring a board game from home). Otherwise, its £1 (so that we can buy new games for the session)

Our motto: We learn by playing.

Hi everyone! My name is Jay and I am a British “Grown” Chinese. Therefore English has become my first language whilst Mandarin and Cantonese has sadly become my second. I believe there are lots of you like me who would love to learn, or improve their Chinese because you too believe it would open your world to much more opportunities. As it slowly becomes a consuming economy, China is where the money is. If you happen to be going to China soon, being able to speak the language on a basic level will undoubtedly get you much further, both in terms of experience and money. You might even meet your new best friend here and we all know there is nothing better than having a local show you around their country.

What’s better than learning Chinese by speaking it to a native? This is where you will find those who will be happy to speak, as well as teach you their native language, and all they ask for in return is you speaking to them in yours. Everybody wins, it really can’t get easier than that.

Here are the questions that I guess are in your mind right now and I will answer them one by one.

“Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?”

- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for half the session.

“I don’t know any Chinese at all, would I end up not speaking for half the session and get nothing out of this in the end?”

- No, what is unique about us is that most of each session will be dedicated to playing various games or team building exercises that require only a few key sentences or phrases. We will go through those before we start the games. Since you will be using it immediately and repeatedly, you will being to understand the meaning behind each word that compose the sentence, and you will never forget it again.

“I will only be learning a few phrases each session?”

- Yes, but only at first. After a few sessions, your repertoire will be much bigger, and you will also begin to learn much faster because you can begin to associate different words together to make your own sentences. To us, quality is more important than quantity, even if you learned every sentence in a book in one session, it is useless if you forget it or don’t know how to use it. It’s always better to understand the words that make up only a few sentences than blindly remembering hundreds of sentences.

Lastly, we are a family here, we help each other, have fun and are open to suggestions. We will feel our time is increasingly well spent here, because as we improve individually, so will we as a whole.

If it’s your first time here, we will introduce ourselves to you at the door and introduce you to a few people in our group. There is no need to be anxious about not knowing where to sit or having to introduce yourself. And the best part is, because everyone is focused on the game they are playing, you don’t have to worry all eyes being on you the moment you come through the door. The next time you are here, we will introduce you to a few new people, and in no time you will naturally be a part of our family.

Come join us and easily take away something amazing. We hope to see you soon.

Jay

Required of members:

Have a sincere attitude to learning, be considerate to others and finally, to have fun.

title: Speed up your Chinese – Pronunciation Workshop – Initials j, x, q
description:
* Are you finding Chinese tones confusing?
* Are you often frustrated because your Chinese friends or family cannot understand your Chinese because of your pronunciation?
* Are you confused by the Pinyin tone change rules?

Then these are the workshops for you.

Our series of 5 pronunciation workshops are slow-paced workshops that aim to help you master the tones, distinguish similar sounds, decipher confusing pronunciation rules, and therefore help you speak (and understand!) Chinese with confidence!

**Workshop Outline**
By attending, you will see **immediate** improvements in your speaking and listening of Chinese Mandarin. Specifically, you will be able to:
• Confidently distinguish (hear and say) the initials j, x, q with other similar sounds

**Why are we different?**

* We believe in practice makes perfect - so this workshop is slow-paced, with lots of practice and guidance
* Personalised to each student’s individual challenge
* Small class - so we can focus more on you
* Have fun! We love having fun as much as you do!

**Your Tutor: Jin Chen**
Jin has a strong Education background with well-blended teaching experience gained in London and China. Her friendly but firm approach makes her a popular teacher with our students. She has 6 years of teaching experience and has MA in Education, BA in Chinese Language, Literature, and Applied Linguistics.

**Who is China Unbound?**
Most Chinese schools focus on grammar, writing, and rigid regurgitation. At China Unbound, we develop students’ ability to truly converse, understand and actively apply. We specialise in teaching adults, working with employees and businesses from SMEs to Fortune 500s. Learning Chinese with China Unbound is fun, fast, easy, and personalised. [Visit our website ](https://china-unbound.co.uk/personal/)for details.

**Price**

* £15

**[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-pronunciation-workshop-tricky-initials-j-x-q-tickets-367505878977)** to use Member code **NihaoCU5** to save £5!

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**The Pronunciation Workshop Series::**

**Workshop 1 (13 JULY, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Initials z, c, s**
Distinguish (hear and say) with confidence the initials z, c, s

**Workshop 2 (27 JULY, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Initials j, x, q**
Distinguish (hear and say) with confidence the initials j, x, q

**Workshop 3 (10 AUG, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Vowels l, u, ü**
Distinguish (hear and say) with confidence the vowels I, u, ü
Y and w – the writing rules and when it should be pronounced

**Workshop 4 (24 AUG, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Vowels +**
an vs ang, en vs eng, in vs ing
a vs ao, o vs ou, e vs ei
u vs ui, ei vs ui, üe vs üan

**Workshop 5 (7 Sept, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tones**
Get to really know the difference between the 4 tones!
Demystifying the rules of tone changes

**Book today and start to speak Chinese like a native!**

**Got questions?**
Contact us at info@china-unbound.co.uk!

title: China Unbound's Language Meetup
description:
We are back to Face to Face meet-ups on the first and third Sunday afternoon of each month!

This is a community for Chinese (Mandarin and Cantonese) and English learners of all levels to learn from one another in a relaxed social environment. Our host is an experienced Mandarin tutor from China Unbound. 😊

OUR COVID MEASURES:

* Hand sanitising is compulsory before joining us at the table (we will be providing sanitising gel)
* Physical space between each seat
* Minimise touching the ‘conversation cards’ and consider taking a photo on your phone once you have selected it (if you did, use the sanitising gel)
* Keep us updated if you have been asked to self-isolate or feel unwell during/after a session
* Check updates on meetup messages in case we reach out to you

🤘 FORMAT: SPEED-CHATTING!

* We will pair you up with a native speaker of your target language.
* We will provide fun, engaging topics to prompt your chat.
* Every 15 minutes we rotate with different people.
* This ensures you cover a diverse range of vocabulary and get to speak to as many people as possible, making the best use of your time here!

🤘 WHERE?
EV Cafe - a lovely cafe located in Southwark, Central London.

This meetup is hosted by China Unbound, a Chinese language, culture and business training school, with happy clients including PWC and ICBC Standard Bank. For more details, visit: https://china-unbound.co.uk

***

FAQs:

1. Are the sessions suitable for beginners?

* Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so beginners will at least learn the short answers to questions like: 'what's your favorite food and where can I get it?' - 'Chinese food at China Town!' From then, you can slowly build up your repertoire.

2. Are the sessions suitable for intermediate/advanced speakers?

* Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so no matter what level you are at, you will be able to practice it to your level.

3. Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?

* No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for at least half the session with our 'Speed-chatting' format!

We hope to see you soon.

## Grace xx

title: Speed up your Chinese – Essential Grammar Workshop – Verb complements
description:
This new series of 5 workshops makes complicated, essential grammar points in Chinese clear and easy to understand.

You do **not** need to know characters to join.

**Workshop Outline - Verb Compliments (like why do we say 看到 kandao to mean ‘see’, rather than just 看kan?)**

1. Result complement – 到 dao
2. Result complement – 完 wan
3. Direction complement – 上(去) shang / 下(来) xia / 回来hui lai /回去 hui qu

**Why learn with us?**

* We believe in practice makes perfect - so this workshop is slow-paced and student-centred, so you will have lots of practice with your tutor and classmates!
* Learn faster and effectively.
* Small class - we can focus more on you.

**Your Tutor: Chloe Xu**
Chloe has a strong linguistic background with an accolade of lecture, research, and academic scholarships from China (Fudan and Yangzhou University) and Korea (Seoul National University). She is a very friendly, patient tutor and is very popular with our students at all levels. Chloe is excellent at making complicated things clear and simple to understand.

**What level is this course suitable for?**

* Any level learners who wish to refresh and consolidate the essential grammar topics listed.
* You do **not** need to know characters as Pinyin will be provided alongside the characters.
* However, it is **not** for complete beginners as you need to participate in the exercises.

**Who is China Unbound?**
Most Chinese schools focus on grammar, writing, and rigid regurgitation. At China Unbound, we develop students’ ability to truly converse, understand and actively apply. We specialise in teaching adults, working with employees and businesses from SMEs to Fortune 500s. Learning Chinese with China Unbound is fun, fast, easy, and personalised. To see other Chinese courses that may suit you, **[visit our website.](https://china-unbound.co.uk/personal/)**

**Price**

* £15 for one, £65 for all 5 workshops (see below)
* **[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-essential-grammar-workshop-usage-of-de-tickets-361797454927)** to use code **NihaoCU5** to save £5 - Hurry, limited spaces!

**Book today and let us help you speak Chinese like a Pro!**

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**All Events in The Essential Grammar Workshop Series::**
To book ALL or MULTIPLE workshops, please **[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-essential-grammar-workshop-usage-of-de-tickets-361797454927)** (use code NihaoCU5 for a £5 discount).

**[Workshop 1 (27 JUNE) - Usage of de 的](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286655640/)**

1. How to use 的 to mark possession
2. How to use 的 to modify nouns
\- Adjective \+ 的
\- Verb \+ 的
\- Phrase \+ 的
3. When can we skip 的?

**[Workshop 2 (11 JULY) - Making Comparisons](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286658715/)**

1. A 比 B + adjective
2. A 比 B + adjective + degree (一点儿/很多/得多/measurement)
3. A 比 B + 更/还 + adjective
4. A 跟(和) B 一样/相同/不一样/不同
5. A 跟(和) B 一样 + adjective
6. A 没有 B + adjective

**[Workshop 3 (25 JULY) - Active & Passive - usage of 把 ba VS 被 bei](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286658740/)**

1. Usage of 被
2. Usage of 吧
3. When to use and when not to use 被/把 structure

**[Workshop 4 (8 AUGUST) - Verb complements (like why do we say 看到 kandao to mean ‘see’, rather than just 看kan?)](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286697209/?isFirstPublish=true)**

1. Result complement – 到 dao
2. Result complement – 完 wan
3. Direction complement – 上(去) shang / 下(来) xia / 回来hui lai /回去 hui qu

**[Workshop 5 (22 AUGUST) - Final modal particles (those words at the end of the sentence that you always wondered when to use which!)](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286658959/)**

1. Interrogative (吗 ma / 呢ne / 啊 a / 吧 ba)
2. Imperative (吧 ba / 啊a )
3. Exclamatory (啊 a)
4. Affirmative (的 de / 吧 ba / 啊 a)

To book ALL or MULTIPLE workshops, please **[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-essential-grammar-workshop-usage-of-de-tickets-361797454927)** (use code NihaoCU5 for a £5 discount).

**Got other questions? Please contact us!**

title: Speed up your Chinese – Essential Grammar Workshop – Final modal particles
description:
This new series of 5 workshops makes complicated, essential grammar points in Chinese clear and easy to understand.

You do **not** need to know characters to join.

**Workshop Outline - Final modal particles (those words at the end of the sentence that you always wondered when to use which!)**

1. Interrogative (吗 ma / 呢ne / 啊 a / 吧 ba)
2. Imperative (吧 ba / 啊a )
3. Exclamatory (啊 a)
4. Affirmative (的 de / 吧 ba / 啊 a)

**Why learn with us?**

* We believe in practice makes perfect - so this workshop is slow-paced and student-centred, so you will have lots of practice with your tutor and classmates!
* Learn faster and effectively.
* Small class - we can focus more on you.

**Your Tutor: Chloe Xu**
Chloe has a strong linguistic background with an accolade of lecture, research, and academic scholarships from China (Fudan and Yangzhou University) and Korea (Seoul National University). She is a very friendly, patient tutor and is very popular with our students at all levels. Chloe is excellent at making complicated things clear and simple to understand.

**What level is this course suitable for?**

* Any level learners who wish to refresh and consolidate the essential grammar topics listed.
* You do **not** need to know characters as Pinyin will be provided alongside the characters.
* However, it is **not** for complete beginners as you need to participate in the exercises.

**Who is China Unbound?**
Most Chinese schools focus on grammar, writing, and rigid regurgitation. At China Unbound, we develop students’ ability to truly converse, understand and actively apply. We specialise in teaching adults, working with employees and businesses from SMEs to Fortune 500s. Learning Chinese with China Unbound is fun, fast, easy, and personalised. To see other Chinese courses that may suit you, **[visit our website.](https://china-unbound.co.uk/personal/)**

**Price**

* £15 for one, £65 for all 5 workshops (see below)
* **[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-essential-grammar-workshop-usage-of-de-tickets-361797454927)** to use code **NihaoCU5** to save £5 - Hurry, limited spaces!

**Book today and let us help you speak Chinese like a Pro!**

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**All Events in The Essential Grammar Workshop Series::**
To book ALL or MULTIPLE workshops, please **[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-essential-grammar-workshop-usage-of-de-tickets-361797454927)** (use code NihaoCU5 for a £5 discount).

**[Workshop 1 (27 JUNE) - Usage of de 的](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286655640/)**

1. How to use 的 to mark possession
2. How to use 的 to modify nouns
\- Adjective \+ 的
\- Verb \+ 的
\- Phrase \+ 的
3. When can we skip 的?

**[Workshop 2 (11 JULY) - Making Comparisons](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286658715/)**

1. A 比 B + adjective
2. A 比 B + adjective + degree (一点儿/很多/得多/measurement)
3. A 比 B + 更/还 + adjective
4. A 跟(和) B 一样/相同/不一样/不同
5. A 跟(和) B 一样 + adjective
6. A 没有 B + adjective

**[Workshop 3 (25 JULY) - Active & Passive - usage of 把 ba VS 被 bei](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286658740/)**

1. Usage of 被
2. Usage of 吧
3. When to use and when not to use 被/把 structure

**[Workshop 4 (8 AUGUST) - Verb complements (like why do we say 看到 kandao to mean ‘see’, rather than just 看kan?)](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286697209/?isFirstPublish=true)**

1. Result complement – 到 dao
2. Result complement – 完 wan
3. Direction complement – 上(去) shang / 下(来) xia / 回来hui lai /回去 hui qu

**[Workshop 5 (22 AUGUST) - Final modal particles (those words at the end of the sentence that you always wondered when to use which!)](https://www.meetup.com/chinaunbound/events/286658959/)**

1. Interrogative (吗 ma / 呢ne / 啊 a / 吧 ba)
2. Imperative (吧 ba / 啊a )
3. Exclamatory (啊 a)
4. Affirmative (的 de / 吧 ba / 啊 a)

To book ALL or MULTIPLE workshops, please **[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-essential-grammar-workshop-usage-of-de-tickets-361797454927)** (use code NihaoCU5 for a £5 discount).

**Got other questions? Please contact us!**

title: Speed up your Chinese – Pronunciation Workshop – Tricky Vowels +
description:
* Are you finding Chinese tones confusing?
* Are you often frustrated because your Chinese friends or family cannot understand your Chinese because of your pronunciation?
* Are you confused by the Pinyin tone change rules?

Then these are the workshops for you.

Our series of 5 pronunciation workshops are slow-paced workshops that aim to help you master the tones, distinguish similar sounds, decipher confusing pronunciation rules, and therefore help you speak (and understand!) Chinese with confidence!

**Workshop Outline**
By attending, you will see **immediate** improvements in your speaking and listening of Chinese Mandarin. Specifically, you will be able to distinguish:

* an vs ang, en vs eng, in vs ing
* a vs ao, o vs ou, e vs ei
* u vs ui, ei vs ui, üe vs üan

**Why are we different?**

* We believe in practice makes perfect - so this workshop is slow-paced, with lots of practice and guidance
* Personalised to each student’s individual challenge
* Small class - so we can focus more on you
* Have fun! We love having fun as much as you do!

**Your Tutor: Jin Chen**
Jin has a strong Education background with well-blended teaching experience gained in London and China. Her friendly but firm approach makes her a popular teacher with our students. She has 6 years of teaching experience and has MA in Education, BA in Chinese Language, Literature, and Applied Linguistics. Jin’s class is fun and interactive.

**Who is China Unbound?**
Most Chinese schools focus on grammar, writing, and rigid regurgitation. At China Unbound, we develop students’ ability to truly converse, understand and actively apply. We specialise in teaching adults, working with employees and businesses from SMEs to Fortune 500s. Learning Chinese with China Unbound is fun, fast, easy, and personalised. [Visit our website ](https://china-unbound.co.uk/personal/)for details.

**Price**

* £15

**[BOOK HERE](https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/speed-up-your-chinese-pronunciation-workshop-tricky-vowels-tickets-367511164787)** to use Member code **NihaoCU5** to save £5!

\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-\-

**The Pronunciation Workshop Series:**

**Workshop 1 (13 JULY, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Initials z, c, s**
Distinguish (hear and say) with confidence the initials z, c, s

**Workshop 2 (27 JULY, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Initials j, x, q**
Distinguish (hear and say) with confidence the initials j, x, q

**Workshop 3 (10 AUG, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Vowels l, u, ü**
Distinguish (hear and say) with confidence the vowels I, u, ü
Y and w – the writing rules and when it should be pronounced

**Workshop 4 (24 AUG, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tricky Vowels +**
an vs ang, en vs eng, in vs ing
a vs ao, o vs ou, e vs ei
u vs ui, ei vs ui, üe vs üan

**Workshop 5 (7 Sept, 7 - 8.30pm) - Tones**
Get to really know the difference between the 4 tones!
Demystifying the rules of tone changes

**Got questions?**
Contact us at info@china-unbound.co.uk!

group.name: China Unbound's Language Meetup 中英语交流

title: China Unbound's Language Meetup
description:
We are back to Face to Face meet-ups on the first and third Sunday afternoon of each month!

This is a community for Chinese (Mandarin and Cantonese) and English learners of all levels to learn from one another in a relaxed social environment. Our host is an experienced Mandarin tutor from China Unbound. 😊

OUR COVID MEASURES:

* Hand sanitising is compulsory before joining us at the table (we will be providing sanitising gel)
* Physical space between each seat
* Minimise touching the ‘conversation cards’ and consider taking a photo on your phone once you have selected it (if you did, use the sanitising gel)
* Keep us updated if you have been asked to self-isolate or feel unwell during/after a session
* Check updates on meetup messages in case we reach out to you

🤘 FORMAT: SPEED-CHATTING!

* We will pair you up with a native speaker of your target language.
* We will provide fun, engaging topics to prompt your chat.
* Every 15 minutes we rotate with different people.
* This ensures you cover a diverse range of vocabulary and get to speak to as many people as possible, making the best use of your time here!

🤘 WHERE?
EV Cafe - a lovely cafe located in Southwark, Central London.

This meetup is hosted by China Unbound, a Chinese language, culture and business training school, with happy clients including PWC and ICBC Standard Bank. For more details, visit: https://china-unbound.co.uk

***

FAQs:

1. Are the sessions suitable for beginners?

* Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so beginners will at least learn the short answers to questions like: 'what's your favorite food and where can I get it?' - 'Chinese food at China Town!' From then, you can slowly build up your repertoire.

2. Are the sessions suitable for intermediate/advanced speakers?

* Yes, the way we set up the questions allows you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so no matter what level you are at, you will be able to practice it to your level.

3. Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?

* No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for at least half the session with our 'Speed-chatting' format!

We hope to see you soon.

## Grace xx

欢迎来到Chinese/English Conversation Meetup with China Unbound 英语交流！我们是一个专为中英文学习者提供的交流社区。我们的目标是在轻松的社交环境中相互学习, 通过对话提高语言能力,和为中文和英文学习者建立社区。

我们的主持人精通英语, 普通话和广东话。在这里，你可以找到以英语和广东话为母语的人练习和提高你的英语/广东话水平。

🤘 模式：快速聊天！
我们将为您安排一至三位英语为母语的语言伙伴，每隔15分钟，我们会与不同的人轮换。我们将提供有趣的话题，协助您开始对话。这个模式确保我们覆盖不同的词汇范围，也可让您尽可能与更多的人交谈，充分有效地利用您在这里的时间！

🤘 常见问题解答：

1. 我最后会不会一直说中文而一无所获？
-不会，因为每个人都必须用我们的“快速聊天”模式用中/英文交流至少一半的时间！
2. 这些小组适合初学者吗？
-是的，我们设置问题的方式使您可以根据自己的意愿回答问题的长短，因此初学者至少会学到问题的简短的答案，比如：“您最喜欢的食物是什么，在哪里可以买到？ ' -“唐人街的中国菜！” 慢慢地，你会学到越来越多的词汇。
3. 这些小组议适合中级/高级学者吗？
-是的，我们设置问题的方式使您可以根据自己的意愿回答问题的长短，因此，无论您处于什么级别，都可以按照自己的水平练习。

😊 我们期待很快见到你。

Grace XX

***

本个小组由China Unbound支持，我们是一家为企业和专业人士提供中文、中国文化和商务培训的专业机构。我们的客户包括PwC和ICBC standard bank。请登陆官网查看: https://china-unbound.co.uk

欢迎来到Chinese/English Conversation Meetup with China Unbound 英语交流！我们是一个专为中英文学习者提供的交流社区。我们的目标是在轻松的社交环境中相互学习, 通过对话提高语言能力,和为中文和英文学习者建立社区。

我们的主持人精通英语, 普通话和广东话。在这里，你可以找到以英语和广东话为母语的人练习和提高你的英语/广东话水平。

🤘 模式：快速聊天！
我们将为您安排一至三位英语为母语的语言伙伴，每隔15分钟，我们会与不同的人轮换。我们将提供有趣的话题，协助您开始对话。这个模式确保我们覆盖不同的词汇范围，也可让您尽可能与更多的人交谈，充分有效地利用您在这里的时间！

🤘 常见问题解答：

1. 我最后会不会一直说中文而一无所获？
-不会，因为每个人都必须用我们的“快速聊天”模式用中/英文交流至少一半的时间！
2. 这些小组适合初学者吗？
-是的，我们设置问题的方式使您可以根据自己的意愿回答问题的长短，因此初学者至少会学到问题的简短的答案，比如：“您最喜欢的食物是什么，在哪里可以买到？ ' -“唐人街的中国菜！” 慢慢地，你会学到越来越多的词汇。
3. 这些小组议适合中级/高级学者吗？
-是的，我们设置问题的方式使您可以根据自己的意愿回答问题的长短，因此，无论您处于什么级别，都可以按照自己的水平练习。

😊 我们期待很快见到你。

Grace XX

title: China Unbound's Language Meetup
description:
We are back to Face to Face meet ups!

This is a community for Chinese (Mandarin and Cantonese) and English learners of all levels to learn from one another in a relaxed social environment. Our host is an experienced Mandarin tutor from China Unbound. 😊

OUR COVID MEASURES:
* Hand sanitising is compulsory before joining us at the table (we will be providing sanitising gel)
* Physical space between each seat
* Minimise touching the ‘conversation cards’ and consider taking a photo on your phone once you have selected it (if you did, use the sanitising gel)
* Keep us updated if you have been asked to self-isolate or feels unwell during/after a session
* Check updates on meetup messages in case we reach out to you

🤘 FORMAT: SPEED-CHATTING!
* We will pair you up with a native speaker of your target language.
* We will provide fun, engaging topics to prompt your chat.
* Every 15 minutes we rotate with different people.
* This ensures you cover a diverse range of vocabulary and get to speak to as many people as possible, making the best use of your time here!

🤘 WHERE?
EV Cafe - a lovely cafe located in Southwark, Central London.

This meetup is hosted by China Unbound, a Chinese language, culture and business training school, with happy clients including PWC and ICBC Standard Bank. For more details, visit: https://china-unbound.co.uk

************************************************************************

FAQs:

1. Are the sessions suitable for beginners?
- Yes, the way we set up the questions allow you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so beginners will at least learn the short answers to questions like: 'what's your favourite food and where can I get it?' - 'Chinese food at China Town!' From then, you can slowly build up your repertoire.

2. Are the sessions suitable for intermediate/advanced speakers?
- Yes, the way we set up the questions allow you to answer the questions as long or as short as you like, so no matter what level you are at, you will be able to practice it to your level.

3. Would I end up speaking English all the time and get nothing out of this?
- No, because it is compulsory for everyone to communicate in Chinese for at least half the session with our 'Speed-chatting' format!

We hope to see you soon.

Jin & Grace xx
---------------------------------------------
